Reviews.Title: “Comfy stay at Loews”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelingAddict
Reviews.Content: Everyone we encountered here was very friendly and professional. The room itself was large, the bed was comfortable, there was nice cold A/C, a huge bathroom, and a shower I wish I had in my apt. It was also really clean and we never heard our neighbors. We faced a parking lot and street - we could hear traffic sounds from the bathroom but for some nice reason couldn't in the bedroom area. Negatives - the tv was off to the side even though there was a lot of room in front of the bed. Not a big deal, but a strange set up. One of the creams was curdled so we threw them all out and they were replaced. We were only given 1 tea each day which wasn't replaced our last day. The hotel is really close to the Riverwalk, which I enjoyed. It's also about a 10 minute walk to the heart of the French Quarter. We had breakfast at another hotel's restaurant called Dizzies - really good french toast and decent prices ($7-$10 for breakfast dishes). All in all, I'd stay here again since it was such a comfortable stay. By the way - do NOT take the New Orleans Airport Shuttle to the hotel. We heard a cab ride for 2 people is $33 one way for a 20 minute ride. Instead we spent an HOUR at non rush hour time because every single person was dropped off at a different hotel - everyone except one other couple was a single traveler which meant lots more drop offs. On the way back to the airport, the shuttle was 15-20 minutes late. The doorman said that they're always late. When it finally came there was no one inside. We were first yet they were still late. The security line at the airport was ridiculously long so it was stressful. Do yourself a favor. If you are traveling with someone else, take the cab!

Reviews.Title: “Great intimate boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: tinydancer1221
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! Pretty, cute, stylish, clean, intimate, well appointed and conveniently located. The hotel staff were amongst the friendliest and most helpful I've ever encountered. Fromt he front desk, to the waitstaff and bell staff, everyone was right there but not so muhc as to hover. I was there for a week-long conference and most of the attendees had similar reviews of the hotel. The concierge, James, was especially helpful and cheery, putting up with our constant questions and requests in a professional and friendly manner...he seemed genuinely caring. I had an issue with my shower upon arrival and it was promptly taken care of. My only ding, and it's not a big one, is the restaurant didn't open for breakfast until 6:30 and I would have liked it to open at 6:00. Walking distance to most everything.

Reviews.Title: “Laizze la Boton Roulle”
Reviews.Author: SMS06
Reviews.Content: Let the good times roll at Loews. Wonderfully friendly place. From the bellmen, to the front desk, to the bartenders, to housekeepers, to the spa and to the guy waxing the lobby floor at midnight (who gallantly squeeged off a dry path for two toddering old fools out past their bed times) this Hotel ROCKS!

Reviews.Title: “Not as close as we would've liked...”
Reviews.Author: Liz M
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and roomy but some of the furniture was a little worn out and faded. The bathroom was big enough and the shower pressure was wonderful. No soft water at this hotel. Oh, and the feather-downed pillow were great, nice and firm. The room also included a self-service one-cup coffee maker and the hotel supplied you with Emeril's Gourmet coffee, decaf, teas, and hot chocolate.We didn't use it but the gym was big and had lots of cardio machines as well as weight training machines available. The hotel was in the business district and we felt it wasn't as close to the French Quarter or Bourbon Street as we were led to believe. It is in walking distant but it took a little bit of a walk. One night we took a $7 taxi ride to Bourbon Street. The only places close to this hotel were Harrah's Casino and the Riverwalk Marketplace. The area was pretty dead at night but there were quite a few nice restaurants in the area hotels including Emeril's.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views”
Reviews.Author: windycity_773
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Nola Loews was recommended by a friend. Overall a great experience. Our room was spacious with a great view of the river. Our "package" included $100 food/beverage credit which we used for breakfast & one light dinner. The food & service in the restaurant was good. Our only complaint was that on 2 out 4 days we did not get housekeeping while out of our room. We called the front desk & they sent someone immediately but it was annoying nonetheless to return to an unmade room after being gone 5-6 hours. Apparently if you are not out of your room early enough housekeeping skips you. They need a better system to keep track of this. Many hotels have a tag to hang on the door, probably a good idea for Lowes

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie H
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel for many reasons but I think my top reason is the staff. From the moment we got out of the car to the moment we left I felt like I was special and the only guest! Everyone called me by name from the moment I encountered them. They called my room to see if I needed anything a few hours after checking in and called again to see if we wanted suggestions about dining! I'm difficult to impress but the staff here impressed me on more than one occasion. We arrived very early for our reservation and despite being very busy the front desk person (wish i could remember the young man's name) was excellent! We were shown to a room immediately. I requested a fridge when I made the reservation but because we arrived at 9am rather than 3pm that room was not ready but the guy with the refrigerator was waiting at our new room when we got off the elevator! I am still impressed with that kind of efficiency. It is a short walk to the Quarter and directly across from Harrah's. The concierge James was fantastic and his suggestions for restaurants and meals were spot on every time! Julio gave great recommendations too and answered all our questions when he brought our bags up to the room. He made us feel so comfortable. I could go on and on but you get my point. Just stay there! You will not be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Chain with a boutique, swanky feel”
Reviews.Author: FloridaMom3
Reviews.Content: Allows pets! Wanted to stay in French Quarter, but in a place that didn't smell like Goodwill or have roaches. Found this place that allows pets for a $25 fee (much better than the $150 non-refundable other hotels charge). They have doormen, and was on nice street. Felt like an apartment in the Upper East Side, NY. They delivered dog bowls and a keepsake dog collar charm to the room after we checked in. There was an area outside with grass and area to walk your dog. The room was large. Ceilings extremely high, granite counters, plush robes, shower separate bath. Right across from Harrahs casino (which has a full service Starbucks), nice indoor heated pool with hot tub and sauna. Kid friendly, good chef quality food, and bar drinks made with real juice. Will stay here again for sure. Perfect local between the heart of the quarter and Garden District. Eat at Acme Oyster. Not nice looking place and had to sit with strangers, but the grilled oysters reminds one of escargot. So good!

Reviews.Title: “What's Not To Love?”
Reviews.Author: kqhouston
Reviews.Content: About this hotel. Absolutely nothing! Stayed here several times, once is a wonderful corner suite & in standard deluxe rooms. Close to the Quarter, aquarium, & river, great rooms with great river views, great amenities, nice lobby bar with a loud and a quiet area, and the staff makes everyone feel like they're the only guest in the hotel. I keep thinking there'll be SOMETHING disappointing, but it never happens. One of my favorite hotels in New Orleans, & it'll probably be one of yours, too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Loews NOLA”
Reviews.Author: TPC37
Reviews.Content: Don't bother researching other hotels. Just returned from a few nights stay. What's not to like? Clean, spacious room, helpful staff, great location, and won't set you back as much as others. If you like watching sports Archie Manning just opened up a great bar a block from the hotel - fun watching March Madness over there, he even made an appearance. Loews is a really nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I Love NOLA!!”
Reviews.Author: DYHFL
Reviews.Content: This was Spring Break week for my son, so we decided to go to New Orleans. This was also the week of the SEC Basketball game so there was a lot of "Kentucky Pride" going on!! The hotel through all it's activity was so great to it's guests...from the moment of check-in throughout the many trips to the concierge desk to ask questions, there was never a moment of feeling stress or lost. The hotel staff was phenomenal to my family. The rooms are a good size and and the beds very comfortable. From the 17th floor, the view of the Mississippi river and the Riverfront Shopping area were fantastic. The hotel is walking distance to Harrah's Casino (across the street), French Quarter (4-5 blocks) and Bourbon St (5-6 blocks) with many restaurants and bars along the way. The Trolley is right at the River walk (about 1.5 blocks) that can take you the Garden District, Audubon Zoo or to the French Market right at Jackson Square. Overall a really good and memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: George W
Reviews.Content: A good hotel for the money relative to others nearby. Rooms were nice, location is good. The valet parking is pricey, but it is nice to have your car secure in a parking garage. But, the valet service is very slow and spotty. Usually, they are very under-staffed, and you have to wait 5-10 minutes just to ask for your car, then another 5-10 for them to get it. For some reason, they never replenished the shampoo during our 4-night stay. That's probably a staff mistake not a policy, and I reported it. Sounds trivial, but it's one of those little things that you notice.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly to Dogs and People”
Reviews.Author: WnnaBTrvlWrtr
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it is dog-friendly -- but we were happy to find that it's also very people friendly. Our room on the 15th floor was quite large and well furnished, with a view of the Mississippi. The bathroom was rather small in comparison, but the towels were thick and plentiful and the toiletries were good quality. The bed was comfortable and the room was pretty quiet. The lobby was comfortable and quite a popular place for guests to spend time taking advantage of the free wireless (rather than paying the rather exorbitant rates charged for in-room connections or use of the business center computers) and sampling drinks from the adjacent lounge. The concierge, the front desk staff and the bell men were all very friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a great location -- within walking distance of the French Quarter, the many good restaurants in the warehouse district and the river walk. The fitness club and spa also was a nice feature. I enjoyed a great massage and a mani/pedi at the Balance Spa the first day we were there -- a great way to begin a vacation! The workout room had a good selection of cardio machines, cybex equipment and free weights. The indoor pool was great for swimming laps, but the lack of windows and rather grungy cushions on the chaises did not encourage lounging. Unlike some of the other hotels, the Loews does not have an outdoor pool or any outdoor seating, so you may want to look elsewhere if hanging out outdoors is important. We (and our canine friend) would not hesitate to return to the Loews New Orleans. It is a comfy hotel in a good location with a great staff -- a combination that's hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “A Few Minor Problems in an Otherwise Outstanding Stay”
Reviews.Author: JYJ101
Reviews.Content: I arrived after a 6 hour drive and left my car with the valet. I sipped the fresh-squeezed fruit juice - a sweet blend of citrus fruits served ice cold - on offer at the registration desk while I checked in. I took my things up to Room 1806, with two queen beds and a lovely river view. I stayed 3 days and enjoyed the trip immensely. A few highlights: The bathroom switch worked only sporadically and required a call to engineering. On checking in, I found that the luggage rack was broken and needed replacement. Both problems were addressed within 30 minutes of my calling the front desk. My first night, I returned to the room to find a half-bottle of wine and a plate of chocolate truffles on the table by the door. Puzzled, I called down to ask why this lovely gift had been left in my room along with a congratulatory card but the woman at the front desk had no idea. She called back a few minutes later with what she thought was the answer. "Are you on your honeymoon, sir?" "No, I'm here alone." "Is it your anniversary?" "It is not." "Your birthday?" "Nope." "Hmm. The note here says that you're on your honeymoon." "My wife would be very upset to hear that." I offered to return the chocolate truffles and wine. "Oh, no, sir. Consider it congratulations for choosing Loews." Very nice, indeed. Checkout was painless, other than the high price tag. I got my car and was deep into the Garden District for a stop at Whole Foods - they carry gourmet cheeses unavailable in East Texas - when I realized I'd left a pair of sport coats in my room. I called the hotel and, when I got there 15 minutes later, the coats were already waiting. In fact, other than the ridiculous $12.95/day Internet charge for a slow connection, the $29.00/day parking fee, a fickle bathroom light, and a broken luggage rack, Loews impressed me. The staff was uniformly outstanding. There was one other potential hitch: I signed up for their rewards program on my second night, only to learn that my stay at the NOLA wouldn't be credited as the rewards number wasn't attached to my reservation before check-in. So be sure to use your rewards number when making the reservation. When I got a survey the next day, I complained about this and the other minor quibbles. The hotel manager contacted me directly and said he'd credited my stay and promised an upgrade for my next visit. I wrote back asking how to claim the upgrade but haven't yet heard back. Nonetheless, I appreciated his response and was impressed that he took customer feedback seriously. The small problems did nothing to take the shine off the hotel. Assuming I had the means, I would stay here again without hesitation. It's a refreshing break from the big corporate chains and a reasonably-priced alternative to the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Houstonian2011
Reviews.Content: Hotel is conveniently located near Harrahs, the Riverwalk and Bourbon Street. Easy and safe walk. Hotel staff was great. Hotel room was very nice. Great coffee in the room and the room service was fabulous! Would definetly stay here again. Only negative was we had a charge from the minibar even though we never used it.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you expect”
Reviews.Author: 4allisons
Reviews.Content: No surprises here. Definitely a safe choice if this is your price range. Rooms are clean and nicely done up, granite counters in the bathroom, etc., etc. Check-in and check-out completely professional and the staff are nice. Location is perfect for the casino--otherwise you're walking a bit to just about everything. The good news is that just about everything is within walking distance--the quarter's over there, Riverwalk is that way, those great restaurants are back there, John Besh's August is VERY close, and heck Mother's is just across the street. (I am a HUGE Mothers fan--go *there* for breakfast if you're in the hotel for a convention). Oh, and if you've never been to Capdeville for a lunch that'll knock your socks off--it's just around the corner. A couple of hints: Like a lot of expense-account properties, Loews still hasn't figured out that WiFi should be free. Heck, they've got hard-wired Ethernet in every room, but they still want to charge for basic connectivity? <Sigh.> And there was no convenience store in the lobby area. So if you need a tube of toothpaste or somethin', your closest place to buy it is the Staybridge hotel about a half a block north. Huge plus: What a great view of the mighty Mississippi! I definitely enjoyed my stay, the place was quiet, comfortable, well appointed and exactly what you expect from a Loews.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth R
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 night stay at this fine hotel.Our room was lovely- well appointed, quiet & confortable with a nice view of the river.We found the hotel's location very convenient. The convention center , Riverwalk & the French Quarter were all within walking distance. The hotel staff, from the front desk clerks to the doormen, were pleasant & attentive.The concierges were cheerful & helpful. James deserves particular mention ,as he helped us track down a leather jacket we had inadvertently left at a cafe earlier in the day. I only remembered the cafe's approximate location .James used the computer to determine which one it was & then called for us to confirm that the jacket was there. We picked it up the next day - much to our relief... We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: bridget138
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel I have ever stayed in New Orleans. Very clean, our room even smelled fresh! The coffee maker in the room was great! The staff was excellent. Didn't get to swim in the pool but it looked very nice. The bed was comfy, and the sheets were too. We had a Deluxe King which had a awesome view. I ordered roomservice which was pretty good. I will be returning to this hotel every chance I get. (The only negetive is 38$ parking.)

Reviews.Title: “Poor mgmt service and security problems”
Reviews.Author: Danaly56
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Friday for 2 nights to attend a Mardi Gras Coronation. Reservations were made through Harrahs in both my husband and my name. I called on Friday morning to confirm that I would be able to check in without my husband and Crantell (front desk clerk)said that I could check in without my husband only to get there and be told that my husband needed to be present. Waste of my time. On Saturday housekeeping left no face towels upon servicing our room. The most serious problem came at 1:00a.m. on Sunday morning when trying to open our door. Neither key worked, the front desk couldn't open it, nor security or maintance. After 2 hours of standing in hallway in tux and evening dress, our door was opened but we couldn't have keys. Maintenance tried twice to open our door after telling them to just wait till after we left in the a.m. The hotel couldn't give any answers as to why and only had 1 front desk clerk and bellman on a Saturday night. Our rooms were comped so they could only offer us a breakfast in their rest. No further stay could be offered. HANDLED VERY POORLY! THE HOTEL WAS BEAUTIFUL UNTIL THERE WAS A PROBLEM WITH GETTING BACK IN OUR ROOM.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Albertomiami
Reviews.Content: The place to stay on Poydras Street New Orleans. However, the restaruant is unreasonable expensive. Instead, eat at the independent hotels a block away on Canal Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: swavemente
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Loews for a convention. The hotel is a fairly short walking distance from just about everything - including the convention center and Bourbon Street. The room was spacious and quite nice - as was the lobby and restuarant.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Mandi M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was outstanding. Best vibe, and bar and lounge seemed to always be open! The sales team paid great attention to detial and our group's reservations were in perfect order. I was impressed by the porters, who were always available to call a cab or assist with luggage. When I checked in, I was in such a hurry to get to the room that I didn't get the mini bar key...so I went back down at a later date. Great view and location. Rooms were large (even the ROH room I was in). Housekeeping however was not the best, we went 2 days without being attended, and even when we called it was still 6 hours before we were serviced. Overall though, I really enjoyed this property and will use it again!

Reviews.Title: “The Loews exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: RunnerMom13
Reviews.Content: We arrived on New Years Day, the staff was friendly and helpful. They upgraded us to a King Suite which was perfect for a traveling family. We originally selected the Loews because so many of the rooms in NOLA only have king sized or double beds, the Loews offers queen sized beds. At checkin we were able to move to a King suite w/ a queen sofabed which also allowed for a roll away bed-perfect for a family traveling with 2 teenagers. The room was spacious, clean, comfortable and afforded us a beautiful view of the Mississippi River. The shower was amazing! All of the staff was helpful and efficient. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but can do better in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: familytripper1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is easily accessible on Poydras. Easy check-in, very clean. Rooms have a somewhat bare, modern feel. Not worth the price I paid. It is across the street from Mother's restaurant which is a great New Orleans "hole in the wall" especially for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it”
Reviews.Author: VaKhalil
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night only, as we wanted to get a feel for different parts of the city, and we loved this hotel. We got a magnificent deal through the Papa Noel Christmas rates. We managed to stay in a King Deluxe, on a budget vacation! The view from our room was great, and the bed was glorious, but my favorite part was the bathroom! Separate shower and tub, and felt very luxurious. If you want to stay at an upscale place without paying the high price tag, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Denise F
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I just returned from a stay at Loews, New Orleans. The location of the hotel is just a short walk to the French Quarter, Riverfront and convenient to all the trolley cars, but not in the middle of the French Quarter chaos. The staff were friendly and helpful from the moment we checked in right up until our departure. Loews is a clean, comfortable, hotel with a great pool and whirlpool spa. The lobby lounge is comfortable for morning coffee or an afternoon drink and has free wi-fi. This hotel is not at all stuffy but is top notch and a great find!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic”
Reviews.Author: Nicole L
Reviews.Content: Hotel is conveniently located near casino and restaurants. My bf and I actually booked the room for one night, as we were attending a late night concert at nearby House of Blues (which was within walking distance of the hotel) and we didn't want the hassle of having to drive home during the wee hours of the morning. Room was very spacious, and our view was spectacular! It included the downtown skyline as well as the Mississippi River! I'd definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for woman traveling alone on business”
Reviews.Author: k2escott
Reviews.Content: I had to travel to NOLA alone for business and I knew no one there...so I worked all day and didn't feel comfortable going out at night...the Loews was a great place to "stay in" as it has a nice gym, spa, bar, restaurant and room service...I stayed in every night and enjoyed it very much. The service was excellent in every way, as was the food (you can order from the restaurant for room service). If I had to be trapped in, I was in a perfect place!

Reviews.Title: “Love Loews New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: emspoppy
Reviews.Content: My favorite hotel in NOLA. Nice rooms, friendly helpful staff, great bar, great restaurant. Stayed last week and had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “started our cruise off great”
Reviews.Author: rolsto314
Reviews.Content: stayed on 21 floor with a great river view. room was large, comfortable,well decorated.conceriage was extremely helpful on getting us on a plantation/ city tour and special courtesy for our 45th anniversity,prior to our cruise. location is great for cruisers,as ship is within walking distance. door main was courteous and helpful. would gladly stay there again for next cruise. close to casino.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy”
Reviews.Author: Tuti05
Reviews.Content: Besides being a very beautiful and clean hotel.... They have the most comfy beds and pillows. The rooms are large, and ours had gorgeous view of the bridge and Mississippi river. The staff is very pleasant. The hotel is located very central of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here - Go Across the Street”
Reviews.Author: sexydem27
Reviews.Content: We ended up leaving this hotel after the incident described below and going to the The Roosevelt New Orleans. It is probably one of the nicest hotels I have ever staid in... classical, not modern, but extremely good service and five star. If you want a cool modern hotel, the W Hotel is located across the street from the Lowes and has far better service. There are two W's in New Orleans, so make sure you pick the right one if you want the one located across the street from the Lowes. You can tell a lot about a hotel by the way you are treated after some type of accident or unfortunate incident occurs. We staid here in September of 2011. Fire alarm goes off around 5am over and over. We had arrived very late that night and were looking forward to sleeping in until around 10am. That, of course, did not happen. We only were able to get about 4 hours of sleep. The number one thing you expect from a hotel is that you will be able to get a decent nights sleep. This should be true of even a Holiday Inn or a Lowes. I would not stay here again or recommended them not based on the fact that the alarm went off repeatedly at 5am, but based on how we were treated when we contacted the front desk and manager to complain. As far as we could tell we, nor anyone else staying in the hotel, was given any significant compensation. Only a very insincere apology. I could tell they were just thinking "we hope these guests leave soon and new ones arrive soon." They stuck us with all of the charges on our credit card and sent us on our way. All they wanted was our money. I won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Expected better given the brand”
Reviews.Author: zedulon
Reviews.Content: Came for 48 hour business trip. The hotel is close, but not that close to much except the casino. Could not get my iPad to connect to the $12.95/24 hour WiFi. i called the hotel help desk and I am fairly certain they were in another country. asked me for the address of the hotel and phone number and then had me on hold 5 minutes while they talked with the supervisor.....are you kidding me? i then find out that i will have to pay ANOTHER $12.95 for WiFi access for my phone...are you kidding me? thank god i didn't bring my lap top. food was fairly average. would have expected a bit better from a Loews. no gift shop or place to purchace emergency items. they send you down the street to another hotel! next time, will stay at the W across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected value”
Reviews.Author: Dnoveau
Reviews.Content: Normally, you might expect a 4.5 star, central tourist disctrict hotel to be very expensive. However, check for deals! On a business trip to the NOLA Garden District, the closest hotel to my destination was a 3-star limited service brand for $149 per night. A little checking revealed the Luxury Loews hotel on Canal ( a short historic streetcar ride away) for $125 per night including a $50 food voucher, so breakfast and one happy hour was free. My room was freshly renovated and had all the standard Loews amenities, which are carefully geared to the busness traveler. Think Ritz with up-to-date interior design and with sincere, great service. It was a super hotel and can't wait to go back (on a deal.)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Balmoral99
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay /Nov 10-14/11/ at Loews very much. It was close to everything - French Quarter, River walk, French Market. Rooms are very spacious and very quite, - extremely comfortable beds. We used indoor pool, sauna and Jacuzzis a couple of times. Nice relaxation in the middle of the day after lots of walking. And especially we liked a coffee maker - Keurig in our room!! As a coffee "addicts" we had this exceptional coffee very morning right in our room in our pajamas and white robes. I will recomend to evryone to choose this hotel when in NO.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of the river with spacious quiet rooms convenient to the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: quedeville
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the view of the river. We had 2 queen beds in a very spacious room and ultra quiet! The workout room is very adequate and we also enjoyed the heated indoor pool. Just a few blocks from the French Quarter and Magazine street this hotel is very well located in a safe area of town! I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Overall quite nice”
Reviews.Author: John N
Reviews.Content: Even though the signs in the elevators tout this as one of the "50 Best Large City Hotels in America" , I wouldn't go that far. It was clean, the bed was WONDERFULLY comfortable, and it was very quiet. The location is great especially if you like to gamble with Harrod's casino just across the street. Room service was very slow. There is no gift or sundrie shop on the property. Staff were helpful and friendly. So, overall very nice, but nothing out of the ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miasig
Reviews.Content: After a disappointing stay at JW Marriott switched to Loews. Exceed all expectations with one minor comment. On check out. front desk person was chatting up the guest for close to 10 minutes when others were waiting to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: NCAlice
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Loews and had an excellent experience. Our room was beautiful and large as well as the bathroom. Great views of the city and location was within walking distance of many restaurants and the French Quarter for shopping, etc. We had a vehicle and enjoyed driving to the Garden District which is our new favorite area for shopping and food...how many times does anyone need to head to Bourban Street??? All in all, a great time and well taken care of by the staff of Loews.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: hiccup1
Reviews.Content: A great place. Great location, great service and killer views. I love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Internet robbery”
Reviews.Author: JPax
Reviews.Content: 12.95 per device for Internet! Â My wife and I each have an iPhone. Â We each have an iPad. Â I brought my laptop. Â $64.75 per day to connect all devices. Â I travel to New Orleans often for business, pleasure, and to visit my son at University. This was my first visit to the hotel. Â This Internet policy negates all of the nice things that could be said about Loews New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Steve H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on Business. Fantastic hotel in a great location only 15 minutes walk from the French quarter. The view from the room over the Mississippi was really spectacular. All of the staff especially the doormen were really friendly and helpful. Only ate breakfast at the hotel as there are so many options for dinner in New Orleans but it was fantastic. One thing to note is the beds - I would have to say that the bed was probably the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in!! I highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “SPA Review....Amazing facial”
Reviews.Author: msspungen
Reviews.Content: I had a TravelZoo voucher for a facial and a manicure. This was my 1st visit to the spa (and my first ever facial). The spa was small but clean and nice. They only had free water which was a downer (many spots offer coffee as well and or juice). They did not have a large waiting area either. The facialist was amazing and the expereince was great. She was nice and explained the process to me. The manicure was okay, the woman was a bit of a downer, but overall the nails came out great. I used the pool too--which was great. There was no sauna or anything, which is usually a staple for spas. All in all, it was a "good to very good" expereince, but part of that is because I saved money on the whole deal by having a voucher. If I paid full price, I doubt I would have loved it as much.

Reviews.Title: “Best room with a view!!”
Reviews.Author: OnTheGoFL
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome. We had a room with a view of the Mississippi. The staff (Bell men, Valet, Front desk) were superb. Good location. Walking distance to everything, French Quarter, River Front, Harrah's Casino, Aquarium & lot's of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: RJO13
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, next to Harrahs so you can go to the casino and not pay for the harrah's pricey rooms. The food was amazing, you are not far from the action on burbon street short cab ride. I liked the quiet area. I was only there for work so could not even all the fun!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for business district and french quarter”
Reviews.Author: Miami_Mark60
Reviews.Content: Good location near french quarter & business district. Stay there for a conferance and found the staff very courteous and helpful. Rooms were clean and spacious but be aware they have a 12.95 internet fee. Our group was able to negotiate with the manager and we were given free internet for our stay, so doesnâ€™t hurt to ask. The hotel is right next to Harrahâ€™s casino and is Â¾ of a mile from Jackson Square. Ask for the river view when you check in. overall the hotel is a bit pricey but all the hotels we check had comparable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: ohammad82
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice. Doormen are very helpful. Check-in is late (4pm). Check out is 11am. The restaurant/bar in the restaurant is fun and busy. It's a 10-15min walk to the French quarters. Mother's restaurant is across the street- yummy food. Overall, good experience, but very pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place - not a standout (particuarly bad OR good)”
Reviews.Author: LJWNYC2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip recently. The hotel was fine - just fine. The location is good (within walking distance of much of what you go to New Orleans to see) and the hotel, for the most part, is clean and functional so an overall decent place to stay (plus they allow pets, which is always nice in case you want to bring your dog or cat!). But it wasn't amazing - things in my room (phone, computer cord) were broken, the sheets and towels looked a little worn, room had a generally ok, but not super modernized feel about it. I probably would stay somewhere else if I were to go back to New Orleans for fun. The beds were comfortable though - I will say that!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Exclusive!”
Reviews.Author: OnDaBeech
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean, very nice view of river. Lobby is very nicely designed. Very impressed

Reviews.Title: “AVERAGE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: SPTrav
Reviews.Content: In a city where good hotels abound, Lowe's does not rise above average. It is showing its age and the lobby is very small. The rooms are very spacious, however, and the views of the Mississippi are nice from the upper floor rooms. The rate, via TravelZoo was very good and included parking. The location is very good, the French Quarter, the Casino, the St Charles Line, etc. are right there. Our only real complaint was that, upon checking in, we were told that a river view room would not be available for perhaps an hour and one-half. Not a problem, we had lunch and visited nearby shops and returned two + hours later. Somehow, we had been forgotten? Another 45 minutes and the room was finally available. We are relatively frequent visitors to the area and adapt well. If your time is limited, you expect accurate forecasts of room availability so you can plan your activities.

Reviews.Title: “Love the NOLA charm and service!”
Reviews.Author: belladolcevita
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing, clean and unique- our room was luxurious and comfortable and SO clean! The staff was outstanding, we had such a romantic weekend getaway, I will come here everytime I visit this city hands down! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Crap”
Reviews.Author: Robbie_Tarls
Reviews.Content: Poor customer service, no inclusions, bathroom shower leaking water, inconvenient location to restaurants and bars. Room and bed was average. Fire alarm drill before 8am without explanation. No wireless in rooms (have to go to lobby). Find somewhere with better customer service and better inclusions.

Reviews.Title: “Fire Alarm Goes off Very Early in the Morning”
Reviews.Author: HippoNC
Reviews.Content: We staid at this hotel in September of 2011. The fire alarm went off early in the morning several times. Then very loud announcements were made over a speaker, repeatedly, saying it was a false alarm. We complained several times to the hotel staff the next day. As far as we can tell they did not do very much for most of the guests. We were offered a free drink at the bar and did not receive anything additional until we complained repeatedly and even then it was not as much as we should have received. The hotel staff blamed the false alarm on a tropical storm that was in the area, but the truth is, the weather was not that bad and we were not aware of any other hotels with fire alarms going off because of the tropical storm. I would not stay here again or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: Ricks911
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week in New Orleans and stayed at Loews. All I can say is this place was excellent in every way! Great location. Great staff. CLEAN! SPACIOUS! We were on the top floor (21) which overlooked the city. Could not have asked for a better room! The shower pressure was awesome. The beds were very comfortable. The cleaning staff was great. I cannot say anything bad about this hotel. Thank you Loews for help making our New Orleans trip a special one!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Comfortable with Nice Amenities In Good Location”
Reviews.Author: cyclistmike
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights, and had a very spacious, well-equipped room on high floor with views overlooking the Mississippi River. Service was good overall, from check in to check out. Nice pool and spa/gym. The lobby restaurant for breakfast was quite good, even if service a little slow--although breakfast not included in our package, I thought the price reasonable. Hotel location is across street from Harrah's, the one casino in New Orleans (if you are into gambling, which I am not) and right down block from Mother's Restaurant, which is a draw for its home-style cooking. Hotel is an easy walk to convention center and in other direction over to Canal Street and the French quarter. This place doesn't have the charm of older properties or the intimacy of smaller ones, but for a chain hotel, it doesn't feel overly corporate, is very comfortable and clean, and for its amenities and modern efficiencies, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, away from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: lporle
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just stayed this past weekend since I won a promotional 'stay-cation' from a local radio station. I would never have thought to stay on the Poydras side of the French Quarter but it really is a great location. The hotel is in a great spot, walking distance to Harrah's, Canal Place, The Riverwalk, French Quarter and also the Wharehouse District. Not only is it convenient to everything but the plus is that it's not noisy since it's not in the heart for the French Quarter. Everyone we came in contact with at the hotel was very friendly and willing to help if needed. The brunch at the hotel restaurant, Cafe Adelaide, was quite delish and not terribly over priced for a hotel. The rooms are very spacious and full of great amenities. I loved having a decent cup of coffee in the room, they have Keurig's with Emeril's coffee in the room with plenty of sweetner/cream (there usually isn't enough for me). The beds were also quite comfortable. The best past was how quiet it is at night, making it possible to get a good night's sleep. I think having stayed in both the FQ and on the out skirts now I would choose this hotel and over and over each time. It's a great get away and so charming.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: VermontEnthusiast
Reviews.Content: My family and I just spent the weekend at the Loews in New Orleans and really enjoyed our experience. We booked a suite using Loews Suite Deal which included free wireless internet, free parking and a $50 room credit per day. This made the huge suite very affordable, and when I say huge, I mean huge. It was bigger than my sisters apartment in Boston! The king bed is extremely comfortable and my 12 year old son said the pull out queen couch was comfy too. Shower pressure is nice and strong, and the shower stall is double size. The suite is in a corner so there are two huge windows in the bedroom and sitting room that overlook the Mississippi River and one window over the whirlpool tub in the bathroom that overlooks the city. The room was clean and the service was top notch. Everyone is extremely friendly and willing to be of service. We had room service for breakfast and the food arrived hot, on time, and with a smile. It was delicious! The location is excellent...just a couple of blocks from the Riverwalk Mall, Saks, and Pinkberry (yes, there is a Pinkberry Yogurt in New Orleans now!), and just across the street from Harrah's Casino. It's a short walk (15 minutes) to Jackson Square but by not staying in the French Quarter, you don't have to deal with the noise and the revelry. This is a quite hotel so you can get a good night sleep. This hotel is a great value and provides excellent customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury without a luxury price”
Reviews.Author: americanwife
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights while in New Orleans and had a great time. The room was huge and the view from the 19th floor was great. We got a deal that included valet parking, which made this luxury hotel the same price as the La Quinta we had originally booked to stay in. Everyone that we interacted with on the staff (bellhops, registration, valet, room service) was friendly and helpful in giving advice on where to go, booking tours and the concierge (Betty maybe?) even called a friend to find out the answer to one of our questions that she didn't know and couldn't find online. They also let one of us who is a pianist play the lobby piano one late night when we got back for about 20 minutes. The location was perfect. Close enough to the fun on Bourbon street when we wanted, but far enough that we weren't bothered by it when we were done. Also walking distance to the WWII and other museums in the area (Ogden, etc). The indoor pool was nice, although I might have liked an outdoor pool to get a little sun one afternoon. I would definitely go back to this hotel when in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Best of both worlds: Peace and quiet close to Bourbon St.”
Reviews.Author: Needsomesun29
Reviews.Content: Upscale hotel within walking distance of Bourbon Street but in the more quiet business district. We walked to the French Quarter and back multiple times daily and had no problems when walking at night. Pillows to die for, bed very comfortable. We had a minor problem with some linens and were treated to breakfast in Adelaide's for the inconvenience. Breakfast amazing but pricey, french toast out of this world. Staff very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Classy as the Ritz, but casual as the Holiday Inn.”
Reviews.Author: SimonTheSpaceWandere
Reviews.Content: Everyone from the doorman to the general manager were friendly and helpful. The bar and restaurant were fantastic. We were there for the Tail of the Cocktail dinner, and the food and cocktails were exceptional. The room was very large in comparison to other hotels, and they had all the detail things I wanted. It is a short walk to the quarter, so a few times we just took the cabs that are right outside the hotel. The river walk and casino were super convienient to walk to though. The bed was very soft, and the linen was nice. Overall, we had a great stay, and will stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great service from hotel staff made our stay pleasant”
Reviews.Author: txmom23boys
Reviews.Content: Doormen, valet, front desk all very accommodating & seem truly happy to provide service to us as their guests. Nice view from our room of the Plaza d'Italia. Comfy beds and a good stay overall! Only downside was no soft drinks or water except for $6 bottled water in mini fridge. Had to walk across street to purchase at another hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Not What Expected”
Reviews.Author: dynamicbush
Reviews.Content: We were expecting more from a '4-star' hotel. It was average in appearance and average in service. Ok for singles or adults, but not for a family. Esp. when you need easy and quick access to your car. We needed to retrieve several items that were left in the car throughout our stay. We waited twice for more than 20 minutes for our car. Not family oriented as far as cost -- everyone expects a tip for any service rendered. We had requested a refrigerator & microwave when we made our reservation one month in advance, and called the hotel a day before our arrival to make sure they would be available. When we arrived in our room, we had a refrig that did not work and no microwave. The process to reserve a refrig and microwave need to be revised (if there is a process). The toilet was also plugged up when we first got to our room, and the second day no one came to the room to clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajimsojka
Reviews.Content: It was a nice hotel. The bed was very comfortable, our view was of the cruise ship dock and the Crescent City Connection. The location is OK, a little far from the Quater, but you can easily walk it. it is across the street from Harrahs, so that is a plus. A little movie trivia note: In the Big Easy, the first dead body is found at the plaza d'Italia. That is right next to the hotel. I live here and always wondered where that was and if it was just a set. . . Cafe Adelaide was horrible. The staff were very nice at the hotel, from the valet to the desk help. Oh, and the shamppos are nice too. My only complaint would be the shower. It has two settings, low and high. Ours only operated on low. That meant no water pressure. I am sure that was just our room and not indicative of the whole hotel. (Ours was room 1715)

Reviews.Title: “I always stay here when I visit the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: Elijah598
Reviews.Content: Over the last two years, I have had to travel to New Orleans quite a bit. This was the first hotel at which I stayed, and have come back religiously since then. The last trip, I ended up staying at the J.W. Marriott, because I was traveling with others who were staying there. Although that was a nice hotel, it did not match my stays at the Loews. I will definitely be returning to Loews. It is near the river and the riverwalk shops, as well as being within easy walking distance to the french quarter. The Aquarium is right near by and me and my wife enjoyed visiting that. For those that gamble, it is right across the street from Harrah's casino - I only get lost in those places, so I do not really go there. Although there are obviously many great restaurants in New Orleans, the one in the Loews is five star rated and is very good with a changing menu nightly. Would highly recommend the Loews to all....

Reviews.Title: “WHAT YOU SEE IS WHAT YOU GET!”
Reviews.Author: hanaiya
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is beautiful and is located in a good area.Service was awesome! Thanks to Julio for getting my purse I left in car when valet service took car,everything was in there and he brought it to me quickly without me thinking hmmm.I thanked him and tipped him.Keep up Being trustworthy it will take you far.

Reviews.Title: “Pet Friendly, People Friendly too!”
Reviews.Author: Ohio_traveler_46
Reviews.Content: From the door men to the concierge to the gym to the management, everyone aimed to please at this well run establishment. Gym was awesome with fresh fruit and flavored water provided. Concierge gave excellent tips on restaurants. Only complaints are no free wi-fi, except in the lobby, and housekeeping was slacking a bit. Business Center charged top dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Girls trip to New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: EnglishinCanada
Reviews.Content: Just back from three fun filled days and nights in New Orleans with my girlfriends. Loews was the perfect place to stay - amazing staff, best location, away from the noise of Bourbon, but close enough to walk to everything. Cafe Adelaide does a great breakfast -start your day there! The rooms are a great size - perfect for the three of us. There's a much needed umbrella in the closet - great for when you go in the rainy season! For food out of the hotel, check out the Royal House Oyster Bar on Royal St - fun, small, friendly and cheap. And grab a drink at the Carousel Bar in the Monteleone Hotel also on Royal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Sandgolds
Reviews.Content: We selected Lowes N.O. as part of a package option on an Internet discount vacation finder (I think it was BookIt.com.) and were surprised at the high quality of the hotel. The room was very clean, fresh and spacious. The hotel had a very nice fitness area and nice pool. The concierges were very helpful and available and the desk personnel too, and even the bellboys were very polite and helpful. The location is just a couple blocks West of the French Quarter, a truly easy walk. This hotel is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wish I had time to stay longer”
Reviews.Author: SRod17
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night while on a work trip, the location is perfect, walking distance to French Quarter and shopping, but not right in the mix with all the drunks. Spacious rooms, great room service and food. I forgot my laptop charger and the concierge was super helpful and looked for one I could borrow. Will definitely stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Warm Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: Creepella
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely, and we were pleased to discover that our room was available when we arrived well before check-in time. The staff is extremely friendly, and takes great pains to greet everyone with a smile and a kind word. Elevator service is prompt, and the rooms are well-decorated and huge. Couples travelling with children: the bathrooms are very large. Housekeeping ranged from good to excellent. The room was always well-cleaned, but the last couple of days we noted some extra touches which really spoke of attention to detail. As an example, one day the ice in which we were keeping our beer cold (we had declined the key to the mini-bar), was replenished. The recreation facilities are lovely, and well-maintained, although the hot tub seems to be very anti-septic. The robes provided in the rooms are luxurious. The only thing we found, having slightly limited mobiility, is that it is a bit farther from El Gato Negro (review pending) than we might have liked.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Radrn60
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Loew's in June for a Convention my husband was attending. The hotel is very nice. Our rooms were typical hotel style but the beds and linens were so comfortable. We got some great sleep while there. The hotel is very convenient to ever thing in the area. Your a few block walk to Bourbon street and all the action. I appreciated walking back to the hotel after an evening out away from the chaos.. Harrah's Casino is across the street for some quick fun. The Concierge staff were very helpful with directions, reservations and any help they could provide. We enjoyed the ice cold lemonade that was provided in the Lobby each afternoon after walking in the heat. We enjoyed the trolley to Magazine street and shopping in the stores. Sucre is a dessert shop that had delicious gelatos, pastries and chocolates. A visit is a must if you enjoy sweets. After long days venturing out sightseeing it was great to come back to the Loew's. Lunch at Adelaide's was delicious, this is in the hotel. We enjoyed the 25 cent martinis.... We will definitely stay here on our next trip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: Coughton54
Reviews.Content: Lowes Hotel was good, rooms are large, decor is ok and staff helpful and professional. But good is not great and to warrant a four star rating I consider a hotel needs to be great. Also, to charge for internet connection is just dismal. Note - valet parking $38/day

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and HUGE rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Scott_ATC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights for a convention and was extremely pleased. Great location! Walking distance to the convention center and the french quarter. Huge rooms with great views. I WILL be back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Friendly Service in a Boutique-style Environment”
Reviews.Author: LionInFLL
Reviews.Content: I arrived to New Orleans to visit a dear friend who is very sick and in the hospital. So when every staff member greeted me with a smile and kindness, it made my trip so much easier. From the bellman to the front desk clerk, the waitresses and the hotel manager, everyone was top-notch. The rooms are spacious and clean with beautiful furnishings and my king-size bed was heavenly. Make sure to visit the hotel bar (the Swizzle Stick) for an amazing cockail, too!

Reviews.Title: “Run down hotel, good location and great service”
Reviews.Author: thorhansen
Reviews.Content: Was pleasantly upgraded to a Grand Suite with nice views of the MS river, but the rooms are very run down and in desperate need of refurbishing. Nice size rooms, excellent service, great gym. But not coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Wachhund
Reviews.Content: Having never been to New Orleans before, we wanted a Hotel that is close to all the attractions as well as to the Convention Centre (which we had to visit frequently). Also, we wanted something modern, as New Orleans has enough "traditional" (meaning run-down) establishments, as we found out reading previous reviews. This hotel offered a very pleasant experience, it was clean, the staff was very friendly and helpful. The gym has everything that you need and the pool really is a "lap-pool". The only negative point was the breakfast in the hotel which was over-priced and the service was sub-par. But that isn't a problem, there are plenty of breakfast places around there, just go to "Mothers" across the street, which is excellent. But all in all - I would stay there again, no question.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: like_jane
Reviews.Content: First trip to New Orleans. Traveled with a family member who was a attending a conference. I was there to explore the city. Loews is in a good central location, a couple blocks from River Walk, Canal Street and the Cable Cars (for getting to the French Quarter and Garden District) -- on the edge of the Warehouse District and Central Business District. Very nice hotel, it's a chain so don't expect the typical New Orleans characteristics. But the rooms are nice, clean, great size, very modern hotel. It is located on a main and busy street, so you might hear some street noise but nothing bad. But the best was the "Customer Service" -- everyone was so helpful, with restaurant suggestions, tours, places to see or just simply getting directions. One of the concierges even remembered my name...impressive (because I wish I remembered hers). They really made my first experience in NOLA great!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Mayday44
Reviews.Content: Came here with some friends for a bachelorette party and had a really good experience. They made sure our rooms were close together, helped us with some of our food and beverage needs and were overall really nice. The rooms are modern, spacious and comfortable. Short walk to the French Quarter and other NO sites. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enormous, comfortable rooms; giant shower; short walk to the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: erictlee
Reviews.Content: After having stayed in expensive, tiny and dark hotel rooms, this was a real trip: a large, comfortable room, with an enormous shower (a rarity in modern hotels). There's free wifi downstairs in the lobby - I would have preferred this in the rooms, but this still better than having to walk around town looking for it. The conference facilities were excellent too. The fitness center was large, clean, well-equipped and a pleasure to use.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: caszsmom
Reviews.Content: My tween daughter, dog and I recently stayed at Lowes in New Orleans. It is located a short walk from Canal St. We walked all but the last day we were there The Insectarium is a 10 minute walk The Aquarium, Riverwalk and Steamboat Natchez are all about two blocks away. The customer service at this hotel is tops. The doormen and bell hops alway friendly. Neil, the concierge very helpful and professional. We requested a room with a view and our request was filled. For the most part our room was very clean. My only complaint was there was a small stain on the rug off to the side that looked like it could have been spot cleaned before we checked in. Being a room for families traveling with pets...I wondered what it could have been. Other than that, the room and bathroom was spotless. The beds were comfortable and they have a Krups coffee maker in the room so AM coffee is plentiful. If your dog is like mine and needs grass...a park is just three short blocks away. . We ate breakfast once at the resturant in the hotel. Cafe Adelaide. Breakfast was good. We also dined there our first night in town. Food good, staff attentitive. I debated about the soup choice and the waiter gave me a taste of the soup I did not order for future referance. Hotel has Indoor lap pool, sauna, hot tub and fitness center. Also, sadly I did not get time to visit the spa. Parking was comparable to any other big city. All and all a very good hotel and would definatly stay there again. PS. If you want to gamble, a casino is a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: harleybonz
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt The Loews is the nicest hotel in New Orleans.We are locals and stayed at just about every hotel in and around the French Quarter and Loews is our number 1 choice..The workers always have a smile and aim to please you.The rooms are very modern and very clean.There are only 2 or 3 hotels that have a spa.My wife likes the Loews Spa.They have an indoor pool and hot tub.There is no way this hotel should not be in the top five hotels in New orleans......

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel with amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: cjzubok
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Loews April 13-16th with my family. Now this hotel is located in the Warehouse District which is on the edge of the French Quarter...a good 15 minute walk from the heart of the action. But this place is awesome! The service from the door man to the valet to the concierge. There's no where else I would stay. The room are large and the view from the 21st floor is amazing. It was a great place to accomodate our children, 3 and 6 years old. Even though its a walk to the French Quarter it is worth it. The river walk is a block away and the Harrah's casino is right across the street. Bottom line...this is where we will stay when we are in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property -- just ask for a no-smoking room!”
Reviews.Author: secondwife
Reviews.Content: The rooms and bathrooms are very spacious, and this venue is well located. The place is beautiful, and the cumulative personal service -- from the restaurant to the bellmen, doormen, hotel taxi drivers, etc. -- is really better than any other hotel I know of. The only thing I'd recommend (I wish I'd known this) is that if you don't like smoke, like me, you MUST ask for a room far, far, away from the smoking floor/s. One floor above doesn't cut it. You'll still smell smoke intermittently if you're like me. The hotel restaurant is okay, not great (okay, the white chocolate bread pudding was superlative) but the entrees, soup, salad were disappointing, especially given the town's raised culinary bar. The $12.95/night internet was fine for normal e-mail, etc., but took a very long time to load Netflix and anything else that has to be buffered -- very frustrating. The spa is very nice and well priced for beauty services. I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Roadtravlr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for one night with family. It was the only hotel available in actual new orleans (that week all hotels were booked because of major conferences) and I refused to stay in the NO 'burbs. Hotel ranks high for customer service in my book--I called about 30 minutes before making it to the hotel to see if they had a room for me even though it was well before check in time--they did and promised to hold the room for my arrival. Upon arriving to the hotel we were greeted by the nicest bellman--Julio. He gave us tips on events happening in the city (we were there during the French Quarter Festival). We had a room with two double beds on the 15th floor--amazing view of the bridge and city! The room was a little stuff when we got in (perhaps because it was 80 degrees out) but we were able to crank up the air to a comfortable temperature. The location of the hotel wasn't too far from central business district of New Orleans or other areas like the French Quarter--about a 15-20 min minute walk. The location is best for folks who want to be close to the riverwalk or Harrah's casino, which is just across the street. My only gripes about the hotel were the charges for internet ($12 in room or free wifi in lobby area only) and the valet-only parking at $35. I tried finding cheaper parking near by, but there really wasn't cheap parking within walking distance I felt comfortable with getting to at all hours. Brightside--the parking is right in the hotel, so you don't wait long for your car to return. While the Loews wasn't my first choice, I did have a good stay thanks the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice place”
Reviews.Author: Salandtal
Reviews.Content: No frills, just nice and convenient for the convention center as well as the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: momsadreamer
Reviews.Content: I was staying at Loews for a work trip- all of our business was at the convention center. It was a pleasant walk to and from everyday. Although we weren't near enough to the French Quarter or Treme to walk (maybe we could have with more sensible shoes) it was a quick cab ride. The service was excellent, from the moment the bellmen helped me out of my cab, to Danielle at the front desk, to the staff at the pool/spa facility. My room was OK--the bed was huge and a bit bumpy/lumpy but I slept just fine. My bathroom was a treat with a large soaking tub and separate shower with amazing water pressure. The noise was my biggest complaint. I was in one half of an adjoining room and could hear the party going on next door as well as conversations of people walking past my door. I also hate having to pay for internet access in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, excellent location, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: monkeylizard
Reviews.Content: Location - The hotel is located on the southern end of Poydras. Across the street from Harrah's casino, a block from the Riverside Marketplace, and about 2 to 3 blocks from Canal Street and the French Quarter. It's a 10 minute walk to the WWII/D-Day museum and 20 to the Super Dome. It's a great spot. Very close to the French Quarter, but far enough from it that you can get away and feel like you can see the rest of the city too. There was always lots of pedestrian traffic on the streets surrounding the hotel. It's in a happening part of NOLA. The property - A great lobby. It's certainly their crown jewel as it features prominintly on their website and on the complimentary postcards tucked inside the information binder in the rooms. It's also the only location in the building with free Wi-Fi. Otherwise, it's a modern high rise building. Nothing spectacular, but it's not unappealing. Reception/Staff- Service was prompt and friendly. The valets were quick to help unload the bags. Charlotte was the front desk team member who greeted us. She did an excellent job and moved us through the check-in process quickly and with a smile. We didn't use the bellhops since we were travelling light, but they were ready if we needed them. The concierge desk was great. Neil gave us some great advice for restaurants and exploring the western end of the city. Another concierge (sorry, I forgot her name, but I do remember she's from El Salvador) set us up with reservations with Magic Tours for a walking ghost tour on short notice. More about that in my review of Magic Tours (hint - it was a great time). Parking â€“ Valet is available for $29/night ($32.48 after tax). Your car is parked in a garage that's part of the hotel building. I didn't see any other real options. An outside lot nearby was $60/day. Room - Very large for a downtown city hotel. As is the bathroom. Both of which I've found to be pretty much the name of the game at Loews hotels. The bed was comfortable and the TV had plenty of channels. A mini-bar and snacks are available too. There is an in-room safe at the top of the closet. I'm tall, so I didn't mind, but a short person would have trouble accessing it. There's a full sized umbrella in the closet too in case you need it. The bed was very comfortable. No free Wi-Fi in the rooms, just the lobby. Bathroom â€“ Again....huge for a city hotel. It had a large soaking tub (personally, I'd never use a tub in a hotel, no matter how sparkling clean it looks) but it's there if you do. There's a separate glassed shower with plenty of room. Food - We ate breakfast in the on-site restaurant. In general, I'm not a buffet fan, but the on-the-menu items were great. I had an omelet and my wife chose the waffles. I ate all of mine and half of hers. Yummy. The accompanying sides were equally hot and fresh. Value - It's a luxury hotel. Expect to pay for it. "Value" and $6.50 cans of M&Ms don't go together in my book, but that's all relative. It's a spacious luxury hotel in a fantastic location with a wonderful staff who make you feel like their job is to serve only you. I think it's worth it. Conclusion â€“ I don't think I'd want to stay any place else in New Orleans. Note to Management: Why can I get complimentary Wi-Fi at McDonald's, Starbuck's, bus stops, highway rest areas, and nearly every chain cookie-cutter $89/night hotel from Bangor to San Diego, but not here? It's even free at truck stops these days. 1998 called. They want their Internet access fees back.

Reviews.Title: “Sister Trip that Started Wrong”
Reviews.Author: crazy2all
Reviews.Content: As our first trip together we three sister's decided to start in New Orleans. Our stay was booked at Loews for the first two nights of our stay because Harrah's was booked. We arrived after midnight to find that our reservation wasn't in the system. Thank goodness for email. When we first entered the room, we all thought it would be fine. We were wrong. The staff wasn't friendly. They weren't rude either, they were indiferrent. We went on a couple of tours our first day and arrived back at the hotel at around 5. The room hadn't been cleaned yet, so my sister called and asked them to make sure they come change out the towels please. We went to the Casino to gamble a bit, and returned after midnight to find the room still hadn't been touched, but there were fresh towels on the Television stand. Dirty towels were still on the floor in the bathroom. Now we were just looking forward to checking into Harrahs to finish out our trip. We went over in the morning and what a difference in staff and cleanliness. Would I stay here again????? Not even if you paid me. To add to the insult, our room was supposed to be comped and when I got home I found a charge for $300 from Lowes New Orleans for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “We don't want to do it quite right”
Reviews.Author: 2cajun
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this property in the past and had a great experience. My most recent Saturday/Sunday stay was horrible beyond comparison. From a dirty vomit filled room to lack of service in the restaurant to poor room service(both quality of the food and lack of timeliness). The management attempted to redress these ills not be comping the room but offerring a "make-up" stay for the family. I was actually thinking maybe this was more typical of Loew's great service when the certificate came for any time BUT the weekend! Not very helpful for a family with children.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2travelingscientists
Reviews.Content: The location is equidistant between the Convention Center and Cafe Du Monde. I like that it is outside the Bourbon street chaos, but easy to walk to if you want to join that party. Loads of great restaurants nearby. I stayed in a Grand King. It was a huge room and very quiet. We slept well. Shower had great water pressure. Sadly I didn't make it to the workout facility during my stay. Lobby bar is a great classy place to meet a friend for a cocktail.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Montagneny
Reviews.Content: I chose the Loewe's after much research. I was in New Orleans for some specialized surgery and needed a great room, comfortable sleeping and quiet environment to help me recuperate. Loewe's has a king suite, which was PERFECT for my needs - a small sitting room with sofa, chairs, TV; separate king bed, and a gorgeous walk-in bathroom with walk-in shower, jacuzzi tub and very large double sink area. My husband and I were given a 15th floor room with a beautiful view of the Mississippi river. The rooms were clean, the bed was tremendously comfortable, the workout facilities/spa/pool very new and generous for a hotel . The Loewe's is right by the Riverwalk, Harrah's Casino, and within steps of the French Quarter. A perfect location, if you want respite at the end of the day. Hotel amenities are great as is all the staff. I'm a "picky" hotel guest and I'd stay again in a minute!!

Reviews.Title: “Easy Big Easy family trip”
Reviews.Author: Gulfcoasters
Reviews.Content: We traveled with four kids, also got a good rate through American Airlines website. Location is great, not right in the quarter, but very easy walk to it and to the riverwalk shopping (which is kind of run down) in the other direction. Big rooms, indoor pool which is a rarity in the area but nice to have in January. Harrahs is right across the street for an evening escape from the kids. We did not eat at the onsite restaurant Adelaide's just because the menu was a little eclectic for the kids. There is a quiet, very reasonable priced little cafe just west of the hotel... M's cafe which became our daily breakfast stop. The staff was great, we had no problems with housekeeping, the beds were fine. This is a very solid four star property and we will return here on our next visit to the Crescent City.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Staycation”
Reviews.Author: JudyPonchatoula_LA
Reviews.Content: Wanted to enjoy the New Year in New Orleans, so returned to the Loews. Dined early in Cafe Adelaide for NY Eve, loved it, then went to Woldenberg Park for the fireworks, and then to Casino, and then back to the Hotel. A great night in 3 blocks! Next day, late breakfast and spa!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous concierge and staff but terrible housekeeping!”
Reviews.Author: Meenakshi M
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Loews Hotel last week. We were there for three nights Here's the good bits - The hotel had our room ready even though we arrived early in the morning (we had requested an early check in) and it was good to be able to check into our room at 10.30 am! The check in staff was good. Polite efficient & friendly. As were the staff in the restaurant & bar. Special mention must be made of Neil and Debbie, who manned the concierge desk on two separate days. They were simply magnificent. Helpful, eager to guide and advise, willing to go out of their way to help. Now for the bad bits - The main problem with the hotel was with housekeeping.Our room had not been cleaned despite calls and reminders! I could not get it. How can you have such good staff and then go and mess it up by not cleaning the rooms? Despite calls and reminders! I finally had to make a scene to get the room cleaned up on the evening of the 3rd day! The other problem was poor internet. Access in the lobby.... the only place with free access to the net. How can a business hotel have poor net connectivity? If at all I go back to the Loews, it will be only for the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best American hotel so far”
Reviews.Author: MIKEYDREAD
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve stayed in many hotels/motels over the last 5 years and this must be the best. Every bit as good as the reviews made out. Very large and high quality room. Easy chair and 2 desk chairs. Safe Biggest bed Iâ€™ve ever slept in.Couldnâ€™t find my wife for 5 nights. Best cooked breakfast we had during our fortnights stay in the US-not free of course. Nice view over the Mississippi river and the French Quarter Nothing to do with the hotel but what happened to all the crime I was warned about on the Virtual Tourist website? Had a couple of mad nights on Bourbon Street and save for drunks passing out, never saw a thing!

Reviews.Title: “overall, didn't deliver”
Reviews.Author: east12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived the day after Thanksgiving and stayed until Tuesday. Our room was very large but the furniture dated, the carpets stained, and the bed far from luxurious. As others have noted washcloths and hand towels were in short supply. Taxis were not easy to come by with the efforts of staff. Clearly some housekeepers did a good job but were limited by poor organization on the part of management. We were out of the room all day on our second day there and when we returned after 4:30 we were dismayed that our room had not been serviced. Upon our complaint, we sat in the lobby until the room was cleaned and learned only later, that again, we had no washcloths. We tried the bar twice and were unimpressed. We had breakfast in the restaurant twice. They could not locate one tea bag of regular black tea. The second time we were the only patrons in the place and smiled at the 3 waiters standing in line. We had excellent omelettes but the toast was burnt black. Strictly as an aside, there was not even a whiff of a holiday decoration on the premises. We did go two times to the elegant bar at the Windsor Court hotel, a very short walk from Loewe's. The bartender, Reggie was a pro and the subdued live music a real plus. If you are in town during the holiday season, I recommend that you visit the Windsor Court and the Roosevelt for some beautiful lights and holiday cheer.

Reviews.Title: “I'll look elsewhere next time”
Reviews.Author: jng06
Reviews.Content: We got a fairly good deal for our room through AAA. I was optimistic about the hotel, but I found that it fell a little short. Our room had a great view (river), but the carpet in the room was heavily stained. I'm sure it was clean, but the stains gave a yucky feel to the entire experience. The bed was very comfortable and we had no outside noise, but noise from people in the hallway came in loud and clear. We didn't use the restaurant, bar, etc. The concierge was GREAT and was a high point for our experience at this hotel. Location was very accessible to the French Quarter and the river. They do have a business center, but charge for computer time, copies, etc...Is this really necessary in a hotel in this price range? Overall, I'll look elsewhere next time...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely big rooms and good housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: fijoh
Reviews.Content: Haven't yet stayed there at a busy Festival time but we plan to do so next April on the basis that this is one of the best NO hotels we have stayed in - and we have tried a good number of different hotels in New Orleans over several years. The rooms are spacious and well equipped and unlike many others we've stayed in, there was no "tired" or scratched furniture. The bed was comfortable and pillows soft, and unlike many NO hotels since Katrina, the housekeeping services are up to, and beyond expectations. Bathrooms are clean, mildew free (I know you should expect that, but post Katrina, its been a bit of a lottery) and the showers are powerful and hot. Staff at reception were friendly and welcoming - given other reviews maybe we got lucky but never came across a problem. The Swizzle Stick bar has just the right atmosphere and the bar staff are knowledgeable and fun. This isn't one of the cheapest places to stay in town but we've paid just as much (or more) in the past and not got anywhere near as good or clean facilities. If the Loews has a downside, its a bit of walk to the far end of the Quarter and the clubs on Frenchman, but its not a very expensive cab ride from there back tothe hotel late at night. And the doormen are brilliant at getting cabs when you leave the hotel - again probably what you might expect, but not always the case at other 4 star hotels in town. The only other downside is that there is no outdoor/sunny pool - but most of the time in New Orleans there isn't time for that kind of stuff. All in all, this is a great option in this price range

Reviews.Title: “Really super experience”
Reviews.Author: Conrad's Walker
Reviews.Content: I used to live in New Orleans and was excited to try the Loews based on recommendations of others. We arrived on Friday night and had a seemless check in and found ourselves in this cavernous room which was really well appointed. The condition of the room was excellent ---- and all the finishes were top notch and not a scuff or mark in the room. All the front desk staff were pleasant and helpful, and the valet and bellstaff were hustling around keeping everyone happy. It was really great....i would recommend it highly. All my thanks to the great staff there at the Loews. Keep up the good work! E

Reviews.Title: “Flea hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel54_10
