Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, too bad they allow pets because we paid the price with flea bites!! Housekeeping did come and take care of the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Business class hotel near the quarter”
Reviews.Author: TravelWarriors
Reviews.Content: Hotel is about 3-4 blocks from the quarter; staff service is vey good;avaiable and helpful; parking is expensive

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced. Much better Values are available”
Reviews.Author: Wishtrader
Reviews.Content: With parking of almost $30 a night my "riverview" room cost about $155 a night with tax and fees. I was very disappointed with my riverview room. The hotel description stated the riverview rooms had wall to wall windows. They don't. They have standard windows. maybe 4'x8' on a 12' x 16' wall. Also the view isn't very good since the window is behind a desk. First thing I noticed as I entered the room was a green M&M (with peanuts) in plain view by the window desk. Very annoying. I got a tissue and picked it up rather than call the staff. The bathroom had mold at the tub tile meeting point. The shower head was discolored with calcium buildup. Yuck. The bed was fine. I felt the staff was good. The concierge was very helpful. The hotel is in a good location but needs a room renovation badly. I've been in 3 star hotels with nicer rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Did not compare to Astro Crown New Orleans we stayed in during month of May”
Reviews.Author: lrburr1027
Reviews.Content: We were unhappy with car parking rates, as seen in news paper and carried article with us it was suppose to be $119 per night and included parking. The bathroom sink was full of debris when we checked in and come to find out the sink was not draining and was backing up. Maids should have caught that before guestnarrived and had to go thru the experience of getting it fixed. The shower had used shampoo in it and no new shampoo was left. The iron was black when I got out my husbands new white shirt to press. I just feel we are due some compesation for this suppose to be luxury week-end. Ralph L. Burroughs [--]

Reviews.Title: “Felt Like a Princess all weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: skippy68
Reviews.Content: I arrived on Friday afternoon. It was odd that there was nobody outside to take my car and assist with my bags. After a couple of minutes, I got out of my car and approached the entrance. A gentleman named Blair opened the door. I informed him that I was to be a guest at the hotel and needed assistance. He came outside and gave me my ticket along with quite an attitude. Thank goodness I am a repeat visitor because we were not off to a good start. Luckily check in was very pleasant. Then Estevon helped me to my room and was very friendly. Our room was delightful with a beautiful river view! Love the fact that the bathroom has a separate shower and bathtub and the robes are luxurious. Spent time at the Swizzle Stick bar and David was a master of the cocktail. Dinner at Cafe Adelaide was delicious and our waiter John made it memorable and fun! On Saturday they had a wonderful singer in the lobby and we had drinks and appetizers served by Josh who always makes a trip to the Loews a pleasure. After my bumpy arrival the rest of the staff made me feel like a princess-pampered and satisfied. Can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay between the French Quarter and the Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: MEGJE07
Reviews.Content: Our group, of 8 adults and 23 teens, traveled to New Orleans for a youth conference. We stayed five nights. The staff at this hotel is polite, rooms are good sized, and the river views are terrific. The only issue we had was at check in. Normally when we travel with that many teens we are assigned rooms on the same floor. Although we arrived in the late afternoon and had booked weeks in advance (through the conference), they wanted to scatter the teens over three floors, some on pull out beds. After standing at the counter quite a while they were able to assign an adult room to each floor and find double rooms for all the teens. Recommendation: if you book a large group here confirm the room assignments before you travel. After that hiccup everything was fine. We walked 49 miles during the conference: from the hotel to the French Quarter to eat and shop, to the the convention center for daytime sessions, to the Superdome in the evenngs. Loved NO. Loved all the friendly people.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2fortheroad26
Reviews.Content: New Orleans is still struggling to make its come back. This is the first time I have been here but I traveled with folks who have been here before and say that it is not the same since Katrina. The hotel was very convenient to the conference center and shopping. We walked to the French Quarter several times. I felt safe in the hotel and the staff was geniune and friendly. We ate in the restaurant and frequented the bar and all the food and service was wonderful. The room was clean and the towels were oversized and very fluffy. The fitness center was a little outdated, tv's on the walls and not the equipment, I was the only person in the room though. We had a great room overlooking the river. If I had to come back to NO, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just an average high rise hotel”
Reviews.Author: djt68
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Loews for a conference in town. Room was spacious but nothing special. Bed was pretty comfortable, but the pillows seemed too soft. I was shocked that the room did not have a flat screen tv. Overall, room was large and clean. Just was expecting a bit more from Loews. This was the most expensive option for my conference, don't feel it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best option downtown”
Reviews.Author: organicf
Reviews.Content: Loews is definitely one of the best downtown hotels in New Orleans. The staff is professional, very accommodating and extremely friendly. We used the concierge a few times for help with getting around town and with booking tours. She was great! The rooms are clean, modern and fairly spacious. The only negative about the room was the very small bathroom - perfect for one or two people, but not for a family. Another very minor gripe is that the TV is an old style tube and there are very few channels. Ask for a room facing the river - the views are spectacular! The location is perfect for New Orleans - just a couple of blocks from the French Quarter, a couple of blocks to the streetcar station and a couple of blocks to the riverfront promenade and aquarium.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, good location, GREAT concierge”
Reviews.Author: krissa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a convention I was attending in New Orleans and found the Loews to be a great hotel. The location, while on a somewhat amenity-less block of Poydras in the CBD, was a convenient central point for the convention (at Ernest Morial) and exploring the French Quarter and Garden District in my spare time. I asked for a room on the upper floors and the very nice receptionist put me on the 21st floor; she also called me when a room was ready far earlier than the 4pm check-in time, so I was able to shower and change before my conference began. I availed myself of the concierge several times; to book me tables at restaurants nearby, to suggest the best time to visit Commander's Palace for lunch, to help me locate a Kinkos, etc. They were helpful even when I called from the convention center with a question. Room service was also really quick and extremely friendly. I came home late after a very busy evening attending conference events, and called down for a light sandwich and ginger ale, and the kitchen sent up cookies and milk! The rooms were incredibly spacious, with plenty of hangers for my wardrobe and great views. My room was efficiently cleaned - I'm a neat traveler so I don't know how the housekeeping would sort through someone's stuff, since I put all my clothes and belongings in drawers - but the room was tidied and vacuumed every day. Finally, the bartenders at the Swizzle Stick Bar are unbelievably friendly and accommodating, helping me put together tables for an impromptu happy hour of 14 people, and they mix great cocktails! This hotel is perfect for the business traveler who'd like to spend a little more money for real comfort, good service, and the right location.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE VALET AND FRONT DESK!”
Reviews.Author: nattyjean
Reviews.Content: We had a family event and selected the Loews over the Ritz, HUGE MISTAKE! We traveled with our dog and since the Loews is known for their dog friendly hotels and the Ritz was so-so on a dog being there, we went with Loews to avoid the stress. I will say that the room was very nice and everyone was nice to the dog. Loved the doggie room service menu. However the first 45 mins and the last 20 mins will forever stay in my mind and we will NEVER stay there again. We waited @10 -15 mins to be greeted by the valet. Then we waited another 10 for them to come back with a cart for the bags. My car was not right in front of the hotel, it was past the driveway they use to enter the parking garage. The valet told me he was right behind me, I went inside to meet my husband in line to check in. I am standing at the window watching and the valet left our bags, which included a laptop, on the streets in New Orleans, to move the car. My husband ran out there to get the cart and the valets response was " its a safe area" You have got to be kidding me! The front desk clerk was not helpful and did not seem to care to help us with this issue. Then the valet would not allow us to push their luggage cart to our room ourselves. This was the same guy who "trusted" our luggage on the street but not us to take it up stairs. We were so mad we carried it all ourselves. THEN when we checked out, a new valet guy let a man coming for lunch park and leave his car in the street and would not move it so I can leave. We were told to back up and go around it! Never Freaking AGAIN! I am waiting to talk to the manager.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent personalized service, beautiful hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: patticakesTemple_TX
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived we were greeted cordially. The valet staff was excellent. The front desk had everything in order. We stayed in a grand king room that had a pull out sofa and a rollaway bed. My husband had a conference, so the 3 teenagers and I hung out to see the sights during the day. Our room was very spacious. We had a great rate of $150 a night. The valet cost of $29, I thought was a bit pricey, but that's what it is in the big cities. The whole week we were there, we never asked for our car. We had a great location. The staff always greeted me by name and were very quick and attentive to our needs. Room service was pricey, but excellent food. The Swizzle Bar was nice with friendly bartenders. The pool was indoors, somewhat small, but it was nice and never crowded. There was also a hot tub and sauna. We did use the workout facilities - great selection there. We stayed at the Marriott on Canal about 6 months ago and this hotel is MUCH nicer, but not as close to Bourbon St. We didn't go to Bourbon St. this time since we had the kids. We were a close walk to the convention center, so the husband walked there instead of taking the bus every day. When we arrived at our room, there was jazz music playing. The cd was ours to keep so this was a nice way to take back a little bit of Louisiana with us. We would definitely stay here again. Oh, and this hotel caters to pets but you would never know that. Everything is so clean, and I never noticed any fuzzy friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good, safe location; welcoming service”
Reviews.Author: msannie57
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights for 30th anniversary. Bellhops were great, check-in was swift. Lobby/bar area was clean and attractive. Room was decorated in neutral colors and very clean; no coffee maker but robes, umbrella and hairdryer. Extremely comfortable mattress and pillows. Bathroom was fairly large. Coffee is available at front desk of Cafe Adelaide for a couple of dollars; was free a couple of years ago when I stayed here. Easy walk to Harrah's Casino, Riverwalk, Quarter, WWII museum, beginning of Magazine Street, St. Charles and City Park streetcar lines. Ate at Cafe Adelaide for breakfast and dinner on previous visit and food and service were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: mrsbeach2u
Reviews.Content: A little pricey but you get what you pay for! Everything from the lobby to the HUGE rooms is top notch. The staff is very attentive! We couldn't have asked for better, unless they threw in Saints tickets too ;)

Reviews.Title: “Our New Favorite in The Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: lisay11
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel- spacious, modern, comfortable, sophisticated. The linens and pillows were like a dream, the breakfast buffet scrumptious, the service from the bell staff was top notch. Only complaint was that front desk staff was not particularly friendly- but our new go-to place for a weekend away from the kids in NoLa!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Good Location - Bring the Dog”
Reviews.Author: LarryScott
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 4-day leisure trip to New Orleans during which we stayed at the Loew's. Here are our observations: Positive: 1. The service at this hotel was impeccable. It could not have been faster, more helpful or more professional in any way. 2. Our room, considered one of their "grand" rooms (19th floor), was very spacious, very clean, and extremely quiet. We had a nice view of the Mississippi River. 3. All of the expected amenities for a hotel of this class were provided, including very comfortable bedding, mini-bar, hair dryer, bath supplies, robes, iron and board, etc. All were of very good quality. 4. The bathroom was enormous, with a large tub and separate, very large stall shower. Water pressure and hot water were excellent. 5. The health club was large and provided many exercise machines, a nice lap pool, and extremely reasonably-priced body treatments. The staff were all charming. 6. The location was good. This hotel is situated among many other high-rise hotels in the downtown business district, directly across from Harrah's Casino (which I suggest you avoid). It's midway between the French Quarter (about 5 blocks away) and the Warehouse District (about 3 blocks away). 7. The concierge was extremely helpful, available, and friendly. 8. Room service was fast and is available 24/7. 9. The hotel is very pet-friendly. 10. A complementary copy of the Wall Street Journal was delivered daily. Negative: 1. While our room was very reasonably priced for a hotel of this calibre, many items carried additional high prices. Bottles of water were provided in the room for $6 each. Internet connectivity is $12.95/day (ridiculous!). Parking is $29/day. Minibar charges were similarly high. 2. There was a distinct "business" feel to all the public areas of the hotel. It was somehow lacking warmth or charm or openness. There is an outdoor plaza on the side of the hotel, but it's only used for catered affairs. Other than a few tables on the sidewalk of a busy street, there are no outdoor lounges, terraces or courtyards. 3. The food in the restaurant was mediocre at best, with the exception of their desserts (the Biscuit Pudding was superb). Overall, we were quite pleased with the Loew's and would recommend it to those who prefer a high-rise, business-class quality hotel that's well-located.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Luckypchw
Reviews.Content: Courtesy coffeepot hard to use. Dust fibers on fixtures. But the biggest complaint I have is this; I accidently left my phone charger in my room when I checked out. After finding this out a day later, I called and it was tough getting anyone to help. Security's phone rang and rang. Tried back and got Randy, who said he would look for it. Didn't hear from anyone, so I called again and asked for a supervisor, who I believe was Mike, who told me phone chargers were practically the most left behind item of a guest, and, that the hotel "had thousands of them" and he would go look. It would seem to me, that if a hotel is acquiring alot of their guests items and isn't doing much to try to unite the items with their owners, then there is a problem. Why keep them if you have no system to return them? What if whoever turns an lost item in, just attaches a tag with the room number on it. Then it could be returned to the person? One other minor complaint is that the people who answer the incoming calls, slur their words badly. The impression is poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful view, restaurant too expensive”
Reviews.Author: BestPick
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the 18th floor with 2 queen beds that were very comfortable. The view of the Mississippi River was especially pretty at night when the bridge was lit up. The staff was wonderful, especially the concierge (Ms. Debbie), who helped us with planning excursions. Our only regret in choosing this hotel was that we always had to go out for breakfast as their restaurant was too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: NJBrooklynborn
Reviews.Content: My husband, 12 year old son and I stayed at the Loews New Orleans for our spring break vacation. I debated long and hard before choosing the Loews and I'm so happy with my choice. The hotel is lovely- elegantly styled, with a swanky feel to it. We arrived at 10 am and although check-in is 4pm, our room was ready! As others have mentioned, a terrific jazz cd was playing as we entered the room, and it is complimentary. A great souvenir to take home. The room was large and well-appointed, complete with bathrobes and great toiletries. Large bathroom with a stall shower and a bathtub. Concierge was wonderful and very helpful. (Thank you Debbie and Daisy!) The restaurant, Cafe Adelaide is fantastic with a great staff, especially Brad. The coffee is amazing. The adjoining Swizzle Stick Bar has the best drinks (especially the Adelaide Swizzle which are 1/2 price at happy hour). There are two friendly doorman to greet guests and open and close the front doors of the hotel every time you enter and exit. The location is perfect. Close enough to walk anywhere in the quarter yet far enough from the craziness. Both my husband and son told me several times, "Boy, you sure picked the right place to stay". One last note: The queen size beds are more like doubles. I raised this issue with management and the situation was handled beautifully and to my complete satisfaction. Yes, this is the place to stay in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Stellar Service & Plush Accommdations But Spa is Forgettable”
Reviews.Author: WellTraveledMrs
Reviews.Content: A large group of us were apart of a wedding party during Dec. 2009. The service provided by the staff members was stellar. Especially those who provided special assistance with the wedding. The rooms were very warm & inviting. Our children gave the rooms 2 thumbs up. The downstairs lounge/bar was comfortable as well. Room service is one of a kind and you are well taken care of. However, for a hotel of this caliber the spa is one of the worst I have visited. The day of my visit I went in for a scheduled (1-2 weeks prior) hot stones massage to later find out that my appointment had been cancelled as well as hot stones were not available because the masseuse did not turn on the warmer. If they can get the spa aligned with some of the "greats" they may merit a another spa visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: JBizzle76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Loews on Poydras for 2 nights to celebrate our 1 year wedding anniversary. Overall, we were very pleased with Loews and would stay again when returning to New Orleans. The location (just blocks from Bourbon) is excellent. When we checked-in, I mentioned our anniversary. We were pleasantly suprised by the champagne and fruit the staff sent up as a "welcome & congratulations" gift. It was much appreciated and really got our stay off to a great start. The room (we had a King on the 16th floor) was huge and overlooked the Mississippi River & Harrahs Casino. The only slight negative didn't have so much to do with the hotel as our next door neighbors; there was a group of 4-5 staying next door who were talking quite loudly after a night out... Not completely unexpected in NOLA, but something to be aware of as the hotel does offer rooms that have doors to adjoin the rooms. We were just about to say something to them as they decided to leave. No biggie but just a minor irritation. The hotel staff was just fantastic. I needed my shoes shined, so I asked for the nearest shoe shine. Instead, the bellman took my shoes to the back, shined them, and returned them to me while I had a cocktail in the Swizzle Stick lounge in the lobby. In addition, we asked the concierge on two separate occassions for recommendations/feedback which she provided (perfectly) and with a smile. Finally, the hotel manager called us on both of our days there to make sure everything was ok and to see if they could do anything to make our stay better. I was always addresed as "Mr. <lastname>"... Sometimes I felt like I should have been paying much more for the room. We had breakfast the first morning at the buffet in the Cafe Adelaide restaurant. Though very convenient, we were more pleased with the food quality and service than the price of the buffet. The hotel bar (Swizzle Stick) is great - the signature drink is excellent and very addicting. I had more than one of them and would recommend. I can't say enough about the staff - they were so helpful. Overall GREAT experience - my wife loved the hotel (and the rest of our weekend); it was the perfect way to celebrate our first year of marriage. Thank you Loews for a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced and "ehh"”
Reviews.Author: KMFA
Reviews.Content: Small room for the price was expecting a nicer room. Could have stayed at Marriott or Hilton and had a bigger room at a better price. Room not ready at check-in. Said 30 min to get it cleaned. Came back 2 hrs later and got the same story. Voiced my displeasure at the canned response and was in a room in 15 min. NON the expierience I expected for the reputation of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Check the price of amenities not included”
Reviews.Author: scrumenot
Reviews.Content: Pros: Pet friendly, nice location, good service, clean room Cons: You will pay dearly for almost anything besides the room, If you are not frugal then don't worry. This includes internet service, room service, parking, phone usage. Things that are usually requested with rooms. If it's not listed call and see if it will cost additional. Pet fees are very reasonable though.

Reviews.Title: “Great restaurant, amenties, room.”
Reviews.Author: XombieTravels
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel while attending a conference, and loved it. I stayed there with a co-worker, and the double room we rented was huge and had great decorations and art. The bathroom was stunning. We rented at the conference rate, which was a steal compared to the rates I saw when looking at going back on vacation, so my idea of the value for the price might be a little off. The restaurant was fantastic, I tried to have breakfast there every day. Best grits I've ever had. They had great cocktails (some very creative ones made up by the resident bartender), as well. It was an easy walk from the convention center and a number of great restaurants. The pool was stunning, and the workout area was nice. It's a little far from some of the other attractions in the city, but New Orleans is super easy to walk in, so we ended up walking everywhere anyway. One drawback: the only free wi-fi was in the lobby. I hate it when they charge for internet access in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful and exciting stay...”
Reviews.Author: skippy68
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Loews Hotel on February 9th. It was the night of the Saints Super Bowl parade. It was a pleasure from the moment we checked in. Bradley handled checked -in with a friendly and efficient manner. Our room was awesome. I love the view of Poydras especially that night b/c it overlooked the parade route. The bathroom was especially bright and airy because it had a window. I love the separate shower (glass door) and deep tub. We were greeted by a great jazzy cd playing in the cd player. The bed was one large king but we also had a lovely chaise along the window. The room seemed fresh and clean. I went down to eat at the restaurant (Cafe Adelaide). I ate at the bar and Kenny made me feel very comfortable eating alone. Some places don't go out of the way to make single diners feel at ease. Food was delicious. The drinks are also special. The bar tenders are mixologists not just robotic bartenders. My husband and some friends joined me later as the excitement built for the parade. The concierge Debbie was very helpful keeping us posted on what was going on with the parade logistics etc... The city was electric and the staff at the Loews was also very enthusiastic. We also stayed at this location for a weekend in December and loved it. We loved our visit and would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “One of New Orleans' best”
Reviews.Author: CajunWave
Reviews.Content: I own a house in the French Quarter but since friends from Boston were staying at the Loews while attending Mardi Gras balls and watching parades, we decided to join in. Stayed four nights at the hotel and it was a GREAT in-town getaway. Large spacious room on the 16th floor with a beautiful bath, nice toiletries and a very quick and efficient room service, even during Carnival. That alone is impressive. The hotel accepts pets but there was no indication that one had ever been in our room (I have allergies) so overall I'd say housekeeping does a wonderful job. Kudos to Loews staff and management.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful anniversary weekend”
Reviews.Author: tigerlily129
Reviews.Content: Living only an hour away, we travel to New Orleans 3-4 times a year and out of all the hotels I have stayed in, Loews is my favorite. The main reason is that it is consistently a great place to stay. The staff is always friendly and helpful- we mentioned at check-in that we were in town for our anniversary and the manager sent us a bottle of champagne! The room was great- we stayed in a Grand King and it is very spacious. A large, comfortable bed with a large sitting area and 2 tv's. The bathroom is great- seperate shower and bath. Very clean! We had breakfast in the restuarant in the hotel- Cafe Adelaide and it was delicious. The buffet was definitely worth it! Also, the bar is very nice- great drinks and great atmosphere. We also had room service one night and it was delicious! Lots of choices on the menu! It is situated accross from Harrah's- about a 5-10 minute walk to the quarter. I will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Event and Stay at the Loews New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: d3conners
Reviews.Content: My apologies to the Loews staff for the delay in this posting. I hosted a retirement party for a fellow co-worker at the Loews, New Orleans in December 2009. Courtney Dubbin, the catering manager, was a pleasure to work with - She worked with me to find a menu that fit in our budget and showcase New Orleans delicious local flavors. Courtney and her staff made adjustments to accommodate late breaking requirements up until just hours before the event. The entire Loews catering and banquet staff attended to every detail to ensure the event went off without a hitch. I don't remember the banquet manager's name on the night of 12/09/09 but I want to commend him also. The event space was beautifully decorated with fresh flowers on the serving tables and since it was Christmas season, there were beautiful decorations throughout the hotel. Many of the party goers took advantage of the special lodging rate for the hotel and they too were extremely pleased with the accommodations. As far as the room accommodations - My husband and I have stayed there for weekend getaways a couple of times and this time was no different. From the time you get out of your car to the time you leave, the staff makes every effort to make you feel pampered. The accommodations are well-appointed and the toiletries are high-end. I usually do not sleep well in hotel but I always sleep well at the Loews New Orleans. The only recommendation I could make is that flat-screen T.V.s would really complete the sleek, sophisticated appearance of the rooms. The staff makes an effort to address you by name - while having breakfast at Cafe Adelaide, the manager and server both called me by name. My compliments to David and his staff for making the Loews a New Orleans gem and to Courtney and the catering and banquet staff for making our event such a wonderful success!!! Weâ€™ll certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Quality, Service and Value”
Reviews.Author: nassaulovers
Reviews.Content: The Loews Hotel blew away all my expectations. From the first step out of the taxi to check out and even after checking out to retrieve forgotten items, the staff were amazing. Very courteous, friendly, helpful and professional. The room was great - excellent comfort and amenities. The location is perfect- close to business, water, shopping, food and the French Quarter. I'll definitely book another trip to New Orleans and will definitely stay at the Loews.

Reviews.Title: “good location, nice staff, costs can add up”
Reviews.Author: cream63
Reviews.Content: I really liked the location, away from the quarter but easy walk there and easy walk to river. The walls are thin so you may hear room noise, very dog friendly, excellent bathroom and walk in shower!!! good views, internet and parking is expensive,, staff customer service varied from average to outstanding..room rates can vary A LOT can be 300 one day 69 the next..check out the courtyard and italian sculpture park next door..oh hotel has a really good fitness center too

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; great location; slightly overpriced for amenities”
Reviews.Author: tx_ladyAustin
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay, and the location was excellent - close to French Quarter & streetcar lines, but far enough away to be quiet. Parking is expensive ($29 plus tax), but that is to be expected in this area. But NO free internet access in the room? Give me a break - even budget hotels have that now! EVERYTHING was extra and pricey. Our mini-bar was missing diet drinks & had to walk over a block to buy any. Beds were very comfortable, & bedding was plush, but maybe too much so. Had to pull LOTS of bedding off beds to keep from feeling smothered under hot covers. We got a good price online, so no complaints, but we have had as much or more comfort & amenities at much cheaper places. Adelaide restaurant staff was awesome, and food was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: BeckL
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mid September. Perfect location. Swizzle Stick Bar - what can I say! We were treated warmly from beginning to end. We asked for dinner suggestions and even though they had their own restaurant - they directed us to Dragos (we wanted oysters) ....... oh my gosh - if you love oysters, heck if you just like them, you must go !!!!!!!!!! Clean, attractive, our room had a nice view - loved it.. Easy to Harrahs, Riverwalk, riverside train, short walk to streetcars. Go for it!!

Reviews.Title: “Good price at Xmas”
Reviews.Author: Godenar
Reviews.Content: A surprising value during the week of Christmas, which was a pretty good time to go to New Orleans. The Loews is on Poydras Street, a couple of blocks from the Hilton at the Mississippi River end of Poydras; across the street from the W Hotel and Harrah's casino, and a couple of blocks from the Pavillon Hotel. 2 blocks on the other side of Canal Street from the French Quarter. The King room without view was a nice size, with big sitting area and 2 TV's, and I didn't really need the river view. My friends' River view room was smaller, but the view on the Mississippi makes for some fascinating observation. The restaurant, CafÃ© Adelaide, is one of the Brennan restaurants, and was pretty darned good, for breakfast, at least. I'll go back to the Loews.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lowes!”
Reviews.Author: Numero10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a 3 night stay at the Lowes and both really loved it. The hotel was immaculate and all dressed up for the holidays, the staff was so nice and the room was just great. I thought it was cute that they left the radio on to a jazz station when you enter the room for the first time (its the little things, right?). The room was very spacious and the bathroom was nice and updated. The bed was SOOO comfortable! We did so much walking in the French Quarter (definitely a walkable distance and worthwhile to save $$ on cabs- that expense adds up REAL fast) that is was wonderful to come back to such a comfy bed. Oh man if I could just take that bed in its entirety home with me! Anyway, I highly recommend the Lowes and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Once you're in, everything will be ok.”
Reviews.Author: NJLawMom
Reviews.Content: This was a business trip, and the room was booked by the office where I was visiting, using their corporate rate. Because of a late arriving flight, I arrived at the hotel at about 2am. Unfortunately for me, this was the same night as the Saints Monday Night football game. Although I had a reservation (confirmed with a credit card) for a king, non-smoking room, the only room available in the entire hotel was a double-bed, smoking room. When I questioned them about my reservation, they said that because it was after midnight, they had released my room (never mind that they would have billed my credit card for the night had I truly not shown up) and the only other option was to shuttle me over the Sheraton for the night (this was a multi-night stay, which means I would have had to come back to the hotel the next night). Now, in addition to being very late at this point, I had a really bad cold and was clearly having trouble breathing already. Yet, the front desk gentleman told me that the room "was not that bad." I ended up taking the room (and waking up with badly congested lungs), and they were able to change my room the following morning. They also did credit me for 1/2 of that night's stay. I do know that the poor woman who showed up at the hotel behind me was sent over to the Sheraton. My business colleague arrived the next day, and when he went to check in at 6pm (yes 6PM), he was told his room was not ready. After an argument, they upgraded his room to a slightly bigger room. Once settled in the room, I would say it was nice but not spectacular. The room is a nice size. However, the bed was not that comfortable, and no matter what temperature I set the thermostat, it was never warm enough in the room. Also, strange shower -- it was a separate stall from the tub, which I like generally, but the water was uneven. It would be flowing fine and then suddenly the pressure just stopped. And not just a little. A couple of times each morning, the water would slow to a trickle, and then it would sound like a motor restarted and the water would flow again. The restaurant in the hotel is pretty good, as we had breakfast and lunch there. Room service is pretty slow, and inconsistent. Despite specific requests for skim milk, for example, I kept getting cream for my coffee. Overall, as I titled this, once I was in the hotel, it was acceptable but not great. A bunch of little annoyances does detract from the overall experience. However, I will be back to NOLA on business and will likely stay here again as the corporate rate we get is quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed. We will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: Bitsy822
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at various other Loews Hotels and I knew they were nice, but this one even exceeded my expectations. I am a You First member and upon checking in, I was offered an upgrade on the upgrade I was already receiving. They had a corner suite available on the 17th floor overlooking the Mississippi River. How could I refuse! It was wonderful. I could have stayed in the room all day admiring the view and using the spectacular bathroom facilities, such as a jacuzzi tub with a TV and huge window above it! But there was a city to explore. The hotel was well situated just a short walk to the French Quarter and Riverwalk. During our stay, we had breakfast twice at Cafe Adelaide, which was good. We had the buffet breakfast both times, which included juice and coffee. The buffet had an omelet station, waffles, bacon, sausage, fruit, breads and muffins, potatoes, grits, very nice breakfast. We had drinks once at the bar, Swizzle Stick. It is a nice quiet bar and good for a relaxing drink. The staff was wonderful and always eager to assist. Everyone was very friendly and they tried to call you by name whenever possible to really give you a friendly feeling. Our room was very clean and the maid service was excellent. Had lots of towels and coffee refreshed every day. I honestly can't find a negative thing to stay about our visit. I would have loved to stay even longer and hope to return again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Character of dsys gone by”
Reviews.Author: PittsburghScrubs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Loews many time and always found it to be a clesn place although the employees seem to be a little stuffy and sometimes rude. We were quite surprised to find our room just did not seem to be cleaned. When we arrived and checked in we noticed we did not have a covering for our bed. Thinking it was in the closet imagine our surprise when we found old used condoms on the closet shelf and some adult toys in the safe and under the bed. The sheets seemed clean enough but they were well stained . My wife is a clean freak so she began a through search of the room to find the carpet was not vacuumed when they cleaned ??? it the next day. We spoke to the young lady who serviced our room( short,African American, wearing shorts) to disc over that the hotel does not have enough vacuum cleaner for each maid. the shower floor had scum and their was mildew in the shower. Needless to say since we had nowhere to go my wife cleaned our room causing us to miss out on sightseeing. We spoke to someone at the desk after getting no response from the manager and they could care less. DO NOT STAY AT LOEWS!!!!! A WASTE OF MONEY. We had stayed there earlier this year and housekeeping back in July was awesome.Just in case someone ac tually reads these you need to get rid of the evil housekeeper on the 15th floor that speaks with an accent. Very nasty attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel within walking distance of The French Quarter.”
Reviews.Author: TLMSLC
Reviews.Content: Loews was selected by a family as a place to stay for out of town wedding guests. The service was great and the staff pleasant and helpful, especially the concierges. It is a 10 to 15 minute leisurely and safe walk to the French Quarter from the hotel. The hotel has a large and well lit exercise room and pool. Very nice. We did not dine at the hotel but service in the busy bar was excellent and the waitstaff were very interactive with guests. The rooms were adequate; the bed comfortable; the bathroom clean and well provisioned. While this is a fine hotel it is not in a particularily scenic area of New Orleans, but that was not an issue for us. One final note: do review your bill. We were mistakenly charged $100 for valet parking though we didn't have a car. Management promptly reversed the charges.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great first stay...we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: iluvdatiger
Reviews.Content: Me, my husband and 3 other couples stayed here for the weekend. When we arrived, the valet opened our doors, and offered to take our bags. They were very prompt in giving us a valet ticket and we went inside to check in. Some of the couples upgraded to a bigger room for like $20. Check-in was quick and easy. Once we got to our room, it was nice and clean. We requested a King bed but got two queens. We had a great view of the river and our room rate was really good so we stayed w/ the two queens. We met the other couples downstairs at the Swizzle Stick Bar, which is known for making a damn strong drink. They won't short you on the vodka!! Anyways, the Seafood Festival was going on a 1/2 block away by Earnst Cafe so we went and ate the Grand Isle restaurant right next to Earnst and then people watched for a little bit outside. The next morning, was when I noticed that the TV was not a very good TV. They should update the TVs to match the rest of the comtemporary room. It was hard to watch some critical football games on that TV. I ordered breakfast from Cafe Adelaide, and it was delivered within 20 minutes. My husband went downstairs and ate from the Cafe Adelaide breakfast buffet for $20 less. For lunch we walked back to the Seafood Festival and tried some of the dishes the local restaurants were serving. You can walk to the quarter if you want, but you will have to cross both Poydras and Canal, which can be a risky walk at night. The hotel is in a great location with the Casino being a block or so away, then there is almost always something going on around Earnst Cafe (a festival or street party of some sort), plus it's an easy walk to Saks. Overall, the hotel was really nice and the staff was very classy. There was even a jazz singer nightly in the lobby. The view of the river from our room (#1901) was perfect! They also allow pets. When it came time to check out, the valet retrieved our car in about 30 minutes, but that gave us time to walk to Lil Dizzy's for a quick sunday brunch.

Reviews.Title: “Expected nicer”
Reviews.Author: travelheart41
Reviews.Content: Looked forward to stay here for long time and wasn't as great as I thought it would be although still nice. Ate at the Swizzle Stick bar off the kids menu - was very impressed. LOTS of food. Plenty for adults too and decent priced. The restaurant was more pricey so didn't eat there. Pool and fitness area were nice. Room was okay but enjoyed the- FREE to borrow- movies at the hotel across the street more. Also, had to pay around $28.00 per day to park

Reviews.Title: “was great and now only good...”
Reviews.Author: carol_a_2004
Reviews.Content: i do not want to down play Loews...but we have stayed here many times and if seems as if the fine tuning we really enjoyed has gone downhilll, and maybe it is just the hard economic times. Our check in was smooth and the valet service still great. At check in I asked about the internet and was told the cost was 12.95 a day. I did need to use it immediately... so after checking in I did the payment and completed my business. We then decided to have a drink in the lobby. It is a great lobby and bar location. I noticed about 10 people on laptops..so I asked someone about it and they told me the internet is free in the lobby. Thank you Loews staff for sharing that with me. I got up the next am around 7 am and head out of the room as not to wake my husband and daughter. I head down to the lobby for coffee which has always been set up on the bar with to go cups..only to find no cups. I ask the desk host at Cafe Adelaide and am told no the coffee is no longer complimentary as they now have cofffee makers in the room. I understand to a degree, but if you are the early riser and try not to wake others coffee is near impossible to make. He gave me attitude but said I could have it this one time...I had no cash on me. The next morning I got up early again and did have the cash...the same host was rude and said the coffee is two dollars and pay me first. Nice first thing in the am. On our final morning...we are leaving for the airport by 7 am...at around 6 I turn in the mini bar key and ask for a copy of the new york times and am told they are already all gone. I said it is only 6 am . I am then told you need to ask for it in advance. Once again thanks for the heads ups Loews. All in all the finer touches seem to be gone...I still love the Hotel juse wish they seemed to love thier customers. too.

Reviews.Title: “Great room for the price”
Reviews.Author: theadolphs
Reviews.Content: Great location - we walked everywhere including the French Market and Frenchman St which are on the east end of the French Quarter. Twice we had to ask for items usually restocked - wash clothes and coffee but we got a great deal at hotels.com $84 with an extra $29 for parking. Everyone charges extra for parking and street parking is hard to find. We had a huge room that overlooked the city. Watch out for the amenities in your room - everything is very pricey. Staff was very friendly and all were willing to help with suggestions on what to do and where to eat. Julio was our fav - always smiling and called us by name. Take an umbrella and carry it with you even if the skies are clear - it will rain! GO TO Preservation Hall and Mardi Gras World (It's NOT at Algiers Point any more, go to the info booth at the end of Canal St to get shuttle) Streetcars (not trolleys!) are great but not reliable transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MontegutMQ
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for several reasons. the location: it's an easy walk to the quarter and we had a great view of the river. It's pet friendly: our mutt pooped as soon as he got out of the car. the porter ran around the corner (to the pet area) and brought back some poop baggies. Then after we checked out and were looking for a good breakfast thay let us stow the god in the office so we could go across the street to Monters and get some grub. WHAT A BREAKFAST! the price: it was $99 per night but with the additional fees of $71 it ended up more that we expected. Overall we were very pleased andwould stay again. The staff was extremely pleasent, helpful and polite. The bartender makes a mean Bloody Mary. The room was large, clean and updated with elegant contemporary details.

Reviews.Title: “Well beyond Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: barah
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based off of location and value. Most others around it were considerably more for similar features. I called ahead before booking on an online discount site and was able to get an even better deal, larger room with two free drinks and the $20 parking for free. Staff is very friendly!! And after driving ten hours with two small children, we weren't very friendly ourselves so the fact they were even nice to us.... nice people! The room is amazing! Over 500 sf, smells clean, bathroom is huge with separate tub and shower, decor is lovely, view is AMAZING of the Mississippi river and my two small boys love watching the tugboats go by! This is a M-U-S-T for any family!! For under $120 per night, you get five star pampering you would pay over $500 per night in any other city! A++

Reviews.Title: “First class all the way...staff, rooms, amenities, location..."”
Reviews.Author: mrshowobject
Reviews.Content: From start to finish this hotel delivered. Cannot complain at all. When returning to New Orleans will only stay at Loews.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel wonderful room with a beautiful view!”
Reviews.Author: sjemomma
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our room, nice and quite. It was cool and comfortable and very clean. Well worth your money. Just a short distance from Jackson Square; and great shops. Would stay here again in the future. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: hedge
Reviews.Content: Very Nice Hotel....But Bathroom small....and no flat Screen TV....and a little Pricey....and $30 a day to park with Valet...and Pool was inside. NO SUN. the Bar was a little pricey also 1 martini and 1 scotch....$25. But the Location was good right across the street from Harrah's Casino. but a $7.00 cab fare to Bourbon St. and 3 blocks from the Street Car. But everyone was very nice there. I guess i,m a little picky..lol

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price, didn't blow me away, overall pretty good!”
Reviews.Author: berserktripon
Reviews.Content: For this class of hotel, the room was a bit lacking. But for the price ($100/night) it was a dilly-o. It's a nice alternative from the other big chains, and from what I saw of my bachelor party buds who stayed at the Westin, I got a much better deal ($130/night for them). GRIPES- The toilet was running and I had to reattach the chain when I got to my room. Not a big deal, maybe it slid off the last time the maid fixed up the room, but still. The bedspread had some worn spots on the pattern. Maybe damage from an iron, but it makes the room look worn. Fix that, it's cheap to do so. Had to pay for internet, doesn't say how much it is. I skipped it. Fiji water bottle for $6 which I broke down and opened. I know it's Loews but for water, just put a liter of the local bottled stuff in there and charge me $3, please? Does anybody need water shipped in from "Fiji?" Aside from not being very green, bottled water is pretty mcuh bottle water. Poland Spring anyone? The breakfast was ho-hum. They're really fake and tense, the host asks you your name when you walk in so that they can call you "Mr. Whatever" throughout the whole affair. Maybe some people appreciate that, but it's phony. And this is New Orleans, so chill out. I got Mr. Whatevered so much, I kept turning around to look for my dad. I'm a 32 year old dude. So were you. Yes, I have a nice watch and I have money to stay here, I stay in nice hotels all the time. But you don't need to do that. It's awkward, note that I look like hell and can barely hold a fork. Make me laugh, and please relax, because I'm trying to. I'm having breakfast solo with a head-splitting hangover. It was going to run me $5 for a lousy bowl of cereal, so I opted for an omelette and the buffett, which they blew and turned into a scramble. Not a big deal, but for $20...though they did fill my coffee three times, and the java was good. Bacon was that thick stuff, too, yum. The big glass of fresh-squeezed OJ was heavenly, and actually quite cheap at $2. It was all good, I guess, but they need to relax and be themselves. Its weird. POSITIVES - High cielings, and room was very cool, despite being top-floor. Shades easy to close completely for when you roll into bed at 7:30 AM. Kuerig Cup coffee maker with and lots of K-Cups of the caffeinated stuff....and mimi-moos, ....not the powdered coffee creamer either. Jackpot. Powerful water pressure in shower - and again on the top floor. Elevators pretty quick. TV was old-school projection, not a flat-screen, but as a frequent-traveler for business and work, this is actually a GOOD thing. If you've ever tried to flip through channels with the new flat-screens at the Marriotts or Westins, it's impossible. There's no channel guide like at home, you wind up hitting 15 ESPNs analog then digital and it takes 30 seconds to go form channel to channel. It's miserable. Kudos to them on waiting until they perfect that technology. I need to just find HBO and CNN, and one ESPN. I don't need 500 channels that will take me 20 minutes to find. I can live with non-HD for one day. Gym was nice and big with lots of equipment - spa looked decent as well. Smoking-hot girls working there. The elliptical were the funny cybex ones, not the precors. But they had TV audio hooked up to them, pretty impressive. I pondered a message, but opted not too for lack of time. Whirlpool looked inviting, pool was a bit small, but whatever. I'd go again I guess, just some minor alterations and this place would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Weekend Trip--Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: islandtigers
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I went to New Orleans for an anniversary weekend trip. We were pleasantly surprised by the beautiful lobby, friendly, professional, and knowledgeable staff, Spa Services, and our spacious king suite. They were sold out of our room, so they graciously offered to upgrade our room (without us even asking!) There was even a complimentary bottle of wine and chocolates in our room for us. The hotel was conviently located to the hot spots of NOLA, including Harrah's, the French Quarter, the Superdome and the Riverwalk. We were also in walking distance of some of the popular restaurants in the area. The staff new exactly where to send us for dinner and breakfast. The best part about this hotel was that it was completely pet friendly, including room service for cats and dogs (litter boxes and litter, pet food and bowls, so you don't have to bring everything from home). It is nice to know that your pet will be as welcome as you are at a nice hotel. We (along with our dog) will definitely book with this hotel every time we visit the Crescent City. This is definitely one of the CBD's hidden gems.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: kudzuhog
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel located in downtown New Orleans. The service was incredible. They acted as if we were the only people there. We felt very appreciated and were treated like royalty. The valet parking was no big deal for me and they told me up front that it cost 29 dollars. The pool and all facilities were very nice and everyone smiled the entire time. The price we paid was less than I would ahve paid for this amazing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: OhioLoves2Travel
Reviews.Content: The resort is located 1 block off of Canal street, which is the edge of the French Quarter. It is just north of the River Walk and next door to the Harrah's Casino. The rooms were very clean and nice. The service was good, but I was surpised when the Concierge was only semi familiar with restaurants in the area. The hotel restaurant was a dissappointment. Limited menu, breakfast wasnt available until 7a when we had an early flight and the food was average at best.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but a bit far from the center of the action”
Reviews.Author: dvg_loves_cali
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our first trip to New Orleans because it seemed like a nice hotel for the price. That's exactly what it was. We were debating between this hotel and the W across the street and after seeing both we feel Loews was the right choice. Our room was very spacious and decorated in a very sleek modern style. It was also very quiet. The concierge was excellent and really helped us plan our stay and overall the staff was very helpful and friendly. The only negative about this hotel is that it is quite a long walk from, say, Bourbon Street. That's not to say it cannot be walked (we did it) but I didn't feel comfortable walking back through some of the quiet streets at night, especially once we got to the areas with less nightlife. The area around the hotel itself seemed safe enough, but there's not much directly nearby except for the Harrah's casino. The restaurant looked good, but we did not try it. However, the hotel had an excellent champagne reception one day and free lemonade in the lobby, which was very welcomed. I would stay here again, but only if I planned to take more taxi rides or if I had my own car.

Reviews.Title: “Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: jerrywanna96
Reviews.Content: The accommodations were fine, the room gorgeous and well-appointed, the staff was adequate though not superb. However, Loews failed to meet the number one requirement in a hotel: we couldn't get a night's sleep. The walls were paper thin. The people next door who were in and out all night starting at 3 AM might as well have been in our suite with us. We could hear every word and every chuckle and down to when one whispered a comment about killing us after the nth time asking them through the wall to be quiet. They were obnoxious but the real problem was that there is no sound-proofing in the walls. Quite an oversight for a HOTEL. So if you are sensitive to noise as I am, this is definitely not your place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent location... but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Ruby&Cody
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a family trip in Mississippi and stopped in/out at Loew's. The hotel is great and we'd go back. We had a corner suite for 2 adults and 2 children, ages 10 and 6, and an adjoining room for grandma and adult son. The suite is huge, with a grand bathroom. The view of the Mississippi River is excellent. Mother's was right across the street with GREAT breakfasts and other meals (don't be intimidated by the line... it moves pretty quickly). All the staff were courteous and responsive. Just one problem with the housekeeping staff... as with the other Loew's we had stayed at ... didn't take out the garbage one day, didn't replenish towels, etc. For that we got our return night comped by the housekeeping manager. (If I ran the hotel, I'd rather do it right the first time than have to comp guests... they really need to pay attention to housekeeping quality!!!). Other than that, we had a GREAT stay. The restaurant onsite, Adelaide, has awesome food... but way too expensive (meal for 4 adults 2 kids = $300). We didn't like being nickled and dimed for parking and internet. Oh well... not perfect, but great! The kids liked the pool. Skip the massage.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: bking00
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to this hotel and I love it. I visit New Orleans often to visit extended family and usually stay at the Windsor Court but decided to try Loew's this time. I was very happy with my decision, the hotel is wonderful and my view was unbelievable. I stayed in room 2009 and had an awesome view of the river, from the bend to the bridge, it was fabulous! The room was very large with a great bathroom with separate shower, no complaints at all. The location is extremely convenient to great restaurants, shopping and the French Quarter. This will not be last stay!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT ROOM! IDEAL LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: mazie164
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here and had a wonderful time. The loews is in a very central location to downtown and the french quarter. The staff were a little bit slow, but we didn't let that bother us. We had lots of room service and the food was fantastic. The bar in the hotel is also great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staycation Destination”
Reviews.Author: JudyPonchatoula_LA
Reviews.Content: I had the privledge to stay at the Loews this past weekend on a staycation. We were upgraded to one of the largest rooms I had the pleasure to enjoy - the seating area with two queens was perfect for my wife, three kids, and I. Great location for going to the aquarium, bug museum, and getting on the streetcar to go get some beignets. My kids loved the indoor pool. Love the bellstaff, they were very friendly, loved the breakfast buffet - the omelet man was great!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: GoesFar
Reviews.Content: First off, it was Mardi Gras in the middle of the 3 days I stayed but that should have no bearing on the concerns I have with Loews. Internet costs $12.95 a day?!? Are you serious?!? This is not an inexpensive hotel and to have a cash grab such this, truly annoying. More than one other person in the group I was with was improperly billed on the minibar in the room. I took nothing but got a bill which was reversed when I protested. Another money grab? Finally, the coffee and paper cups for the morning beverage were not replenished once in 3 days. I suppose that being Mardi Gras the real mugs were locked up for safe keeping but they took the used paper cups and left me with nothing! I stayed for another week in New Orleans and was happy to be at another hotel that was infinitely more accomodating with free internet, resupplied amenities and infinitely friendlier service at less than half the cost and only a short distance away. The lounge and restaurants were overpriced and service was poor, yes I mentioned it was Mardi Gras but people were not even particularly friendly, more exhasperated or annoyed at working and not partying perhaps? I really have nothing positive to say, I was happy to be out of there.

Reviews.Title: “So-so, even on someone else's nickel”
Reviews.Author: HonestReviewForU
Reviews.Content: Got assigned here by my company during a meeting (one of the few times they don't let me pick my own place). No way did they get their money's worth. This is a place that thinks it's all that, but really isn't. There's a fancy bathroom (though, luckily, I had mouthwash from a Holiday Inn Exp, since Loews doesn't provide) and a comfortable bed (though the pillows are all mush), the TV has a good selection and it is a big room. But are you spending so much time there that you need all the space? Didn't pay for Internet, which a colleague says runs around $14/day. Got put in a riverview room. About a block away there are freight tracks. Trainspotters will love it, though no one else will be thrilled as the trains honk at a crossing at the bottom of Poydras St. This goes on at all hours. Also, had some drunks in the hallway a couple of nights. Suppose it comes with being in New Orleans at Mardi Gras. Clerk at check-in was bored by the whole thing. Better on check-out, but they had never slipped a bill under the door and the "check folio" option on the TV never worked the entire time I was there. This meant spending more time on the way out to review the bill. Another colleague was also surprised to find a place like this is pet-friendly. She isn't, and wasn't amused. If this is your cup of tea, I'm sure you'll be pleased. But if you're seeking value on your own dime, keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poorly organized”
Reviews.Author: mk14617
Reviews.Content: Can't comment on value, as the tab for my one-night stay was picked up by others. The hotel was beautiful (with the exception of a very ordinary bathtub), but the staffing was poor. They asked me upon arrival if I wanted the Wall St. Journal delivered. I did, I replied. It never came. I put out the hang-tab for breakfast at 10PM; at 6AM the next morning, when breakfast didn't come, I opened my door and the hang-tab was still there. And only after I emerged from the shower did I discover that my room lacked a hair dryer -- when I phoned to inquire, they doubted me and had me look in four places (with wet hair) before they brought one up. Unacceptable in a super elite hotel, don't you think?

Reviews.Title: “Usually love it here, but last stay was just okay”
Reviews.Author: alyson003
Reviews.Content: I love the location of this hotel and usually like staying here, but I guess they were having an off day this time. When I arrived the staff seemed irritated that I was not going to park my car there. The room was big and seemed clean, but had carpet stains. The room service has changed menus. I recall getting it before and the food was very good, now it is just standard and many items can't be ordered after midnight. Internet access is around $15. I asked for and was given a late checkout, but staff banged on my door twice to see when I was leaving ( I still had an hour before checkout!) I stay often in New Orleans and usually try to stay here, but may go somewhere else next time. If the rates are good I'll give it another try, but there are several good hotels in the area that aren't quite so pricey. I do like the Swizzle Stick Bar in the lobby, the drinks are quite good (as they should be at $10 or more each) Cafe Adelade is a very good restaurant as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience, Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 00bunny
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my husband and 5 year old January 16 to 18 2009. Our experience was wonderful, the room was great, every staff we dealt with was very helpful and professional. The hotel was very clean, the spa was fantastic, and the overall experience was one we would not mind repeating, I have already recommended this hotel to my friend and would stay here again if or when I return to New Orleans. Well worth the price. Travelor from The Bahamas

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CrazyEights15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Loew's Hotel for the Sugar Bowl in New Orleans this year (2009) and had a wonderful experience. The staff bent over backwards to ensure our happiness. The room was clean and our view was spectacular! I would certainly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel location/amenities - housekeep issues”
Reviews.Author: DMBMZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in mid October 2008 for 5 nights. Staff could not have been nicer. Great location and spacious rooms with very decent amenities. As others have written, housekeeping staff could use some instruction on to keep/make rooms cleaner. While there are plenty of hotels in NOLA, I would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel ... BUT .....”
Reviews.Author: smg23
Reviews.Content: The housekeeping issues brought up by other reviewers need addressing. To be plain - the people who clean the room simply do not do it very well - they merely make the beds and change the towels. On several occasions dirty cups and glasses were left in the room, nothing was tidied, the coffee was not replenished and on several occasions on returning to the room at around 5pm after being out all day the room had STILL not been cleaned! On the positive side, I think that the staff are well used to complaints about housekeeping - I think the management do not have any intentions of insisting housekeeping staff improve as the latter are probably paid "peanuts" and it is clearly considered more cost effective to retain lazy staff and compensate guests who make a complaint! Hence we had free drinks, free meals, bathrobes to take home and a whole plethora of goodies! I would suggest that rather than "putting up" with the inconveniences of not having coffee replenished etc that guests do bring this to the management's attention. I think only when half the guests are having to have hundreds of dollars of credit at the bar and restaurant will the low standards of housekeeping be addressed on a more permanent basis. Other than this I agree with all the positive reviews, very comfy and spacious rooms and bathrooms especially in grand deluxe, great location and a wonderful if slightly overpriced restaurant with an atmospheric bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spa”
Reviews.Author: harleybonz
Reviews.Content: Nice upscale hotel with only a few small issues.If your looking for a hotel with class and a top notch spa look no futher.The location is great,it's right across the street from Harrahs and about 5 or 6 blocks from the La. Superdome.Also about 3 blocks to the French Quarter.Don't forget to hit Dragos for it's charbroiled oysters,at The Hilton Riverside(2 blocks).The small issues were the hot tub had a bit of mold,the bed was a bit too firm,and the ac didn't seem to put out too good..But believe me the hotel was still top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: faat1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights right after they opened the city after Hurricane Gustav. The Loews Hotel is exceptional. The facilities are nicely decorated, the lobby is beautiful and air conditioned. The hotel is also pet friendly and in a great location, close to RiverWalk and the French Quarter. The front desk staff are professional and very helpful. Our room was clean, nicely decorated and so comfortable. Great flat screen tv. The bed was firm and the pillows were great. The bathroom had both a tub and separate shower. It also had lots of room to move around. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Staff EVER”
Reviews.Author: RayPRoch
Reviews.Content: We had tickets to see the Bucs play the Saints on Sunday, September 7th. We had airline tickets to fly Southwest on Thursday, September 4th and reservations for 4 nights at Harrah's (free rooms). Then Hurricane Gustav came up the Gulf and a mandatory evacuation was ordered for of all of New Orleans. On Tuesday night Harrah's called and said our reservations were cancelled and they didn't know when they would be ready to open. They were not at all helpful even though we were left with nowhere to stay. I contacted Loews and got a room for 4 nights. Our flight was one of the first ones to arrive in New Orleans after Hurricane Gustav passed. We arrived at Loews about 3 p.m. to a skeleton staff of employees who were either back in the city after the evacuation or had not left. There was still a curfew in effect and very little open the first couple of nights that we were there, but Loews more than made up for any inconvenience. They put out a great (and very reasonable priced) buffet on Thursday night with what they had available since there had not been any deliveries in a few days. It was the best experience we have ever had at a hotel! The restaurant manager, Daniel is a warm wonderful person could not have been more accomodating and efficient. Bartenders and wait staff Angela, Micheal, Michael, David, Lou, Talia are incredible. Nathan from the bell staff was terrific. By Friday we felt like part of the Loews family! We met people who lived locally and had no electricity when they returned home. We met family members of staff who were staying at Loews because they had no electricity at home. We had a great time (even though the Bucs did lose on Sunday). In spite of the adversities of hurricane evacuation the staff at this hotel were just amazing. What could have been a very miserable experience was turned into an outstanding trip for us. Thank you, thank you. You guys are the best! We will pay to stay at Loews the next time we come to New Orleans rather than stay at Harrah's. And, we will definitely be looking for Loews hotels when we travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travman62
Reviews.Content: Our weekend in New Orleans was made so much better by our decision to stay at the Loews Hotel. The staff was amazing, all the guys down in the lobby helped our group of 10 get unloaded and up to our rooms and then were equally helpful in getting us back in the cars for the trip home on Sunday. The restaurant has an excellent breakfast buffet that we enjoyed on Sunday morning.....just what we needed after two nights at Bourbon Street. The rooms were big and clean and the King bed was amazing......best ever. Our view of the river from the 19th floor was beautiful too. Room service at 2am was very prompt, very professional. I would highly recommend this Hotel to anyone staying in New Orleans. The casino was right across the street, so was Mothers restaurant and Bourbon street was an easy walk. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aktx
Reviews.Content: My SO and I stayed here two nights for free (comped by Harrah's); however, I won't let that affect my review. I would most definitely stay here again whether it was free or not. (We recently stayed at the nearby Hilton and it wasn't nearly as nice as this.) We were here on a weekend so we parked on the street for free, so I have no comment on the hotel's parking situation. The front desk staff was great and upgraded us to a nicer room on the executive floor. We had a fantastic view of the city and Mississippi River. This room was like the perfect hotel room: oversized, clean, modern and well-appointed. I loved the large entry area. It provides extra space for things and had a nice long table along the wall with a shelf underneath. The king size bed was extremely comfortable and had very comfy pillows too. There was a sitting area with couch and coffee table as well as a very large desk and chair. The TV, which sat on top of a hutch with drawers, swiveled so you could view it if you were in bed or sitting on the couch. However, unless you propped something behind the TV, it would swivel back around. (The hotel menu book came in handy for something. LOL!) The bathroom was average-size but stylish and had some nice toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, lotion, body wash, sewing kit and q-tips, but no shower cap) and a high-wattage blow dryer. The towels were plentiful and plush and included two oversized bath sheets. Nice! Outside the bathroom was additional counter space on which was an Ipod port & speakers, and underneath that on pull-out shelves was a coffee maker & fixin's (Emeril's coffee, decaf, green tea and black tea), ice bucket and glasses. Across from that was an ample-sized closet with an iron and ironing board and a pair of robes. We don't know if anyone was staying next to us, but we never heard any noise. We enjoyed the New Orleans Picayne newspaper that was left outside our door each morning. We did not make use of the pool, workout room or restaurants so I have no comment on them. The downstairs lobby area was small but very elegant. I noticed they're pet-friendly as when we were leaving I noticed a couple checking in with 2 dogs. I suppose that can be either a positive or negative, depending on how you look at it. I thought the location was perfect: close enough to the French Quarter to walk there, but just far enough away to be quiet. Really perfect location for us. Across the street in one direction is Harrah's Casino and in another direction is Mother's Restaurant. (Mother's may not be what it once was, but you can't go wrong if you order what we did for an early dinner: Mother's famous ham poboys and for dessert, bread pudding!) My one little quibble with Loew's New Orleans would be that housekeeping forgot to replenish our coffee and we had to contact housekeeping twice to get it. Then it took them forever to bring it. Other than that, a perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: alk222
Reviews.Content: I stayed a the Loews for business for three nights. Booked a deluxe king room. Note - the hotel does not guarantee the type of bedding just the level of the room. When I checked in I was given the wrong level of room. It took two calls to get the room straight. The front desk was not helpful but the manager was very helpful and quick to fix the problem. The bed was very comfortable with many nice pillows. The deluxe bathroom had a large walk in shower with a separate tub. More than enough towels . The normal rooms have an average size bathroom - nothing special. The fitness center is small but adequate. There is a lap pool for exercise. The hotel is within walking distance of the riverwalk and the convention center. We walked to the French Quarter though I would not walk home after dark alone. The hotel is directly across the street from Harrah's for those who like gaming. Cabs were very easy to get at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: jasmineflowers
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I, both in our mid-twenties, stayed at Loews New Orleans for a lovely weekend away in early May. We found the accomodations to be very nice. The people were friendly and the room was nice. It wasn't over the top luxury but it was definitely above average. The bar down in the lobby is worth checking out and we had the breakfast buffet one day which was fantastic. New Oleans is a wonderful city! We liked that this hotel was a little bit away from the quarter (but still an easy walk!) since we were there for a romantic weekend. I had never stayed at a Loews before but I would definitely stay with them again based on my experience in NO. Bon voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Good Downtown Choice”
Reviews.Author: shalmunzies
Reviews.Content: Loew's is convenient to all the major attractions.Our room was large and comfortable.Valet, bell service and front desk attentive and efficient. Would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay - 3.5 stars!”
Reviews.Author: KOinCT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a very pleasant stay at the Loews hotel in April 2008. We actually ended up at the Loews due to some unusual circumstances - we were relocated from the Windsor Court due to "special guests" at the Windsor (the President was in town!). Anyway, we were comped a free night at the Loews for the inconvenience, so maybe my review is a little biased(!), but honestly, I think I would have felt the same even if we had paid. Check-in was easy and the front desk staff was incredibly warm and welcoming (refreshing, citrus-infused water was offered to us while we waited). The lobby is small but hip with a nice sitting area (w/tables and chairs) and I believe there is free wi-fi in the lobby. Our room was incredibly clean, comfortable and open with abundant sunlight that flooded into the room through the windows. The layout was very conducive to just moving around without feeling cramped or restricted in any way. The bathroom was also well-lit, nicely stocked with plush towels and very spacious. We did not try any of the hotel restaurants/bars, but Loews is conveniently located across the street from one of the most well-known establishments in New Orleans - Mother's Restaurant - get there early for their fabulous breakfast. Another plus (for us) was being a bit outside of the French Quarter. Nothing is worse than the loud, obnoxious crowds at night, so the Loews was a nice retreat from that. Harrah's Hotel & Casino is also close-by as is Windsor Court Hotel (their afternoon tea is wonderful). We only stayed one night at Loews, so perhaps we didn't see (negative) things that we might have seen had we stayed longer. But for what it's worth, we had no problems whatsoever and wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Loews again in the future. We also had friendly staff upon our exit to help us hail a cab back to the airport. So overall, a wonderful experience and if I had the option, I would actually give this hotel a 3.5 rating instead of just three.

Reviews.Title: “Average service”
Reviews.Author: hal9341
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights on May 2008. First off I must say the hotel is beautiful. The lobby is stunning, and the rooms are lovely too. We had a superior room with a river view. Location is also fantastic. Close to almost all the main tourist attractions. Cannot fault any of that at all. What I found somewhat lacking was service. They weren't major issues, but at this price level I expect better. For instance, they provide you with a tea/coffee maker, but that's not much good when the maid forgtets to replenish the creams. We used all our shampoo and the next day it was not replenished. Instead we had two conditioners left for us. (Maybe we just got unlucky with this maid - I don't know) On the Sunday we decided to treat ourseleves to a nice big breakfast in the hotel. We went down at 9:50am. We were told that due to it being Mothers Day they weren't seating for breakfast anymore! On a Sunday! I was furious. Mostly because I would have expected something like that to be communicated to the hotel guests in advance. There was no offer to allow us breakfast in the room instead or anything along those lines. Then on the last day when checking out they tried to bill me $2.92 for something I'd supposedly had from the minibar. I refused to pay it, and they didn't cause a fuss, but it was yet another example of the service not being 100% at this hotel. The other thing I disliked was the pool. It's not a leisure pool. Just for laps, so there was no where to chill out after a hard days sightseeing in the New Orleans heat. I would only recommend this as a business hotel rather than leisure.
