Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place!”
Reviews.Author: msudog98
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. Beautiful hotel. Large room. Conveniently located to Harrah's, Riverwalk, Children's Museum, Aquarium...

Reviews.Title: “I'll stay at the Loews NOLA again and again!”
Reviews.Author: blondemommy05
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Loews with my husband and toddler son for the first time during the first weekend of JazzFest. As a regular to New Orleans and a former resident, I am very familiar with the hotels and what one should expect, even in a post-Katrina world. I was worried about the mixed reviews that I read before I left for the trip, but all my fears were removed as soon as our cab pulled up to the property and we were literally fawned over by the bell staff and the desk staff. One bell person gave my 2 year old son a magna doodle while we checked in. Apparently, they have toys in the back to give out to kids. So, overall, already I could see this would be a very kid-friendly hotel. Since I am a Loews frequent guest member, I was upgraded to a Deluxe Luxury King on the top floor (21st - room 2119). The bell person let my son ride the luggage cart to the room. My son was happy, so I was happy. The view from the top floor was great. While not a river view, I'm still from the days when there were few tall buildings that one had access to in NOLA and the view towards the lake and Metairie still fascinates me. Our room was HUGE and spotless. It was as big as many "suites" these days, the only thing missing was a dividing wall. There were even TWO tvs! Which I thought was a little overkill but in the end it worked out when there was a big thunderstorm one afternoon and we were stuck in the room and my husband wanted to watch something different from what I was watching. The bathroom - immaculate and well-stocked. One of the best features - there were bath sheets in addition to bath towels! That's a big plus for my husband who is a big guy and usually the bath towels don't fit around him. If I hadn't been travelling with my son, the bath (without shower) being separate from the shower stall might have annoyed me, but it was nice to have a big tub without a shower curtain when it came time to bathe my son. The sheer size of the bathroom was a big plus. My husband and I agreed that the bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds we've ever slept in. As I was also in town on business, we had the pleasure of a business dinner in a private room in the hotel's restaurant Cafe Adelaide. I can't say enough about how wonderful the food was and how attentive the staff was. The only annoying aspect was that we had the Turtle Room furthest in back. There's another "library" room in front of our room that was booked the same night, and we had to walk through that room to get to the bathroom. We also used the Swizzle Stick Bar one day when my son insisted on eating a hamburger but Cafe Adelaide was closed for turnover to dinner. The waiter was more than pleasant to my son and highly attentive. Overall I have to say I only had amazing encounters with the staff. They were all pleasant, happy, and ready to help in any way possible. The hotel is very close to the French Quarter - it's only about 2 blocks to Canal Street from Poydras. The only downside was that bell service at the front door was hit or miss. On Saturday morning at 8:30AM, I needed a cab to get to a meeting. It would have been helpful if the bell person was there to whistle for the sleeping driver rather than my having to walk over to the driver and tap on the window. One time we had to open the doors to the hotel ourselves, other times, there were 3 guys running to open the doors for us. I'm not saying I can't open my own door, just consistency is a good characteristic for a hotel. I highly recommend the Loews. And I'm so pleased with my experience that I've already made reservations for my next trip down in the fall.

Reviews.Title: “Jazzfest”
Reviews.Author: Washington_DCPzero
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay. Room quite comfortable, and hotel in a great location for walking.

Reviews.Title: “Lived in New Orleans; LOVED LOEWS”
Reviews.Author: MomDoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our 10th anniversary and Jazzfest - the service was awesome, the shuttle was very accomadating ; the lounge and drinks wer lovely, the valet was very attentive....we were VERY happy here......they could only do one thing better that I could see....leave the pool and hot tub open LATE at night for folks coming back in the wee hours after fun out on the town.....

Reviews.Title: “Fabulously Overpriced Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: corrineski
Reviews.Content: I tagged along with my husband on a business trip this April and stayed for just 1 night at Loews. It is in a fabulous location across the street from harrahs. It is a few short blocks from Bourbon Street. The room was pristine, the check in was accomodating, the indoor lap pool was beautiful and they have a full service spa. The doormen are friendly and open the door with a smile well before you get there. The view was beautiful and the robes were comforable. I still dream about the shower there! I'm glad the company paid for it, however. This is not somewhere I would have deemed a good value. When we were in New Orleans, we were no where near our hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: Giveypup
Reviews.Content: So, here are the positives and negatives. -Hotel is kinda far out from the French Quarter, but we are walkers so not a big issue -Hotel is sorely understaffed--operator and front desk took for forever to answer the phone, and when they did we were put on hold -NO NOISE ABATEMENT--could hear everything in other room (including a 6 a. m. o'clock alarm clock that went off, and no one was occupying the room to turn it off). Took 35 minutes by the clock for the front desk to send someone to turn it off. -Could hear everything in the hallway -nightstand phone and heater were inititally not working -front doormen ranged from helpful, not wanting to call us a cab, to somewhat helpful -after hours room service food was terrible, before 10 p.m., the food was good -painfully small bathrooms -Nice workout room but no elliptical trainer or television remotes or headphones -nice pool/jacuzzi -nice spa personnel -very good beds- -was upgraded to "suite," really a glorified bigger room with a much larger bathroom -concierge was helpful **Don't pay for wireless in your room--sit near the window and you can capture it for free; also, free in the lobby

Reviews.Title: “loews was nice”
Reviews.Author: LR72202
Reviews.Content: booked through seperate website for the friday and saturday of easter weekend. later i called hotel and verified they had my reservation. sure no problem. called while driving to new orleans and requested late check in. sure no problem. walk in and was impressed with the lobby. go to the front desk i'm sorry we dont have a resevation for you. huh? well here's my reservation number. sorry cant find it. desk clerk asks, "are you tina___" first off i'm male and thats not what i told her my name was 90 seconds ago. well tina___ called and cancelled the two rooms that were reserved. okay so you let someone i dont know call in and cancel my room? yes they did apparently we have the same last name. she had two rooms i had one. when she cancelled her two, one of the ones cancelled was mine. fine fix it so i can go to my room. i walk in the room the lights and radio are on. looked warm and cozy and honestly i felt like i'd made it home. the bathroom was standard but nice and had good shower pressure. i like that. loews is across the street from harrah's and the aquarium is on the other side of that. i didnt have a problem walking to bourbon. it didnt seem like all that far of a walk. i walked along the main street for a 3 or 4 blocks i guess and turned right for another 3 or 4 towards the quarter. i realize it may be far for others especially if you're female wearing high heels. the parking fee is 35 per night. they said guests vehicle are parked inside. there's self parking lot next to the hotel. i cant remember the exact numbers now but it essentially worked out to about a $1 per hour ($12 at a time tho). machine doesnt take billes larger than a 10 but does take atm/debit and credit cards. i noticed a guy sitting in his car. asked him to change a 20 turns out he was off duty police. doing lot security. i'd stay here again no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel except for Housekeeping Problems”
Reviews.Author: Jemimagold
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here 2 nights for Easter weekend. Overall we really enjoyed our stay but I don't feel I can give the hotel 5 stars due to a number of problems with their Housekeeping Dept. Before I go into that , briefly here are the highlights: - Beautifully maintained and very stylish hotel - Front Desk staff were professional, courteous and efficient - Complimentary coffee for guests each morning - Complimentary Paper for guests each morning - Rooms were nicely decorated with pleasant toiletries - Hotel was VERY dog-friendly which was important to us as we brought our dog with us. The problem w/ their Housekeeping is that they refused to make up our room although they were busily vacuuming outside our door at 7:30 am. Anyways, we left our room around 10 am, put the sign on the door to make up the room and took our dog w/ us so that the maids could clean w/o the dog being there. We got back around 1:30 pm and our room had not been cleaned. This was a little annoying as we had hoped to leave the dog there in the afternoon so we could shop without her. I phoned downstairs and requested that our room be cleaned. They said they had "until 4 pm to clean" it but would send someone right away to service the room. We left (and took the dog) and returned at 5:30pm and our room still had not been cleaned!! I then spoke with the Manager who offered to put us in a suite 2 doors down. Which was nice and all but there was the hassle of moving everything (including the dog's blanket, toys, food, etc...). To the hotel's further credit, they offered to waive the 2 days of valet parking as a way to make up for the lack of housekeeping. Which, was very nice of them and much appreciated. Also, 4 days later I noticed an extra charge on my Amex for mini-bar charges for food/drink we did not consume since we did not have a mini-bar key! I imagine Housekeeping had a hand in that error as well. All in all, it was a great hotel and very dog-friendly and I would probably go back. But, I would make very sure at the beginning of the stay that I expected a reasonable amount of service from Housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “A "nice" business hotel near the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: onoman
Reviews.Content: Went to New Orleans for a business trip, accompanied by wife. She is also helping me to write this review. Trip was arranged via travel agent. Check in was smooth, small lobby, doorman and check in were very efficient. Got to room, nice large room with room for sofa, desk, king sized bed. Very clean and well appointed. Small hall area and small storage area on way to bath room help to qualify room as a "suite." Our "suite" on the 17th floor had a view of the Mississippi River. Hotel is adjacent to Harrah's Casino and about 5 blocks to the heart of the French Quarter. The restaurant in the hotel is another of the Brennan family of restaurants. This is a small, vertical hotel, everything with my meeting occurred on floors 8-10. Thank goodness the elevators move very fast given the amount of traffic. Meeting rooms were very nice, well appointed and food was very good, even satisfied my foodie wife. Staff was very helpful with suggestions for places to go and how to get there. While I was in meeting, wife used the gym--although small, had windows, TV and the usual gym equipment. Spa on site with lap pool, neither of us used it. Free coffee in lobby and you get free newspaper each morning. Internet in rooms is wired and has a use fee, anything printed requires trip to business center. Bar was very popular. Negatives--turndown service--you have to call for it. If you wanted any little items like magazines, there is no little shop in the hotel, kind of surprising for a hotel. I don't think that I have ever been in a hotel without a sundry-souvenir shop. Bathroom amenities were not as plentiful or as nice as other hotels in this class. My wife noticed the lack of a shower cap and lack of hair dryer in room, although I thought if you really needed it, they would probably provide you with one. Also if you wanted boarding passes printed, you need to go to the one and only concierge--who was getting slammed Saturday afternoon after our meeting, as everyone was waiting to get their boarding pass at the same time. We all felt sorry for her, she suggested that we write a comment to the management about this situation. Same thing happened with bell captain when we wanted to get our bags to leave--kind of overwhelmed with the rush. Overall a pleasant, but not totally satisfying experience. As far as I was concerned as a hotel for a meeting, it was very good. But if you are staying for fun and games, the location is very good, staff is good, but has a few quirks that make it just above average and not excellent.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL experience in a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: migolfergirl
Reviews.Content: Wow! My husband and I stayed at the Loews N.O. hotel and could not have been more pleased. EXCELLENT service, truly exceptional & wonderful staff, absolutely gorgeous and spacious suite, great restaurant, fun bar/lounge... The location is superb and there are fabulous restaurants within easy walking distance. You are within a few blocks of the French Quarter, and some nice shopping is in a small mall a block away. GREAT location!! We would not hesitate to recommend this lovely hotel to anyone wanting a nice, quiet and beautiful hotel. I read about someone's "issues", and our experience was that any request large or small was handled immediately and graciously. Southern hospitality at its finest!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Skatergirl39
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Loews Hotel this weekend because of the NBA All star events and I must say that this hotel experience was amazing. From checking in to the day I checked-out I felt like I was having a VIP experience. I work at the Ritz-Carlton back home and I was pretty skeptical about how my experience would be at the Loews since I have stayed at several Ritz-Carlton's before. My experience was great and most importantly the doormen were most helpful especially one gentleman named.....Carl.....everyone else was just as helpful but this gentleman stood out among the others...good job Loews!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: Vancouver_Roary
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from Jan 29th to Feb 1st to attend a conference at the Morial Convention Center. Overall, the hotel was good, but I did run into one problem during my stay. Although the person that checked me in was very nice, I found that througout the rest of my stay, the front desk staff and concierge to be less than friendly, and one staff member that was completely disinterested. This was odd, because everyone else I met on the streets, at the convention center and at the restaurants were so welcoming and friendly. I would've expected a friendlier staff in the hotel. I was given a room on the top floor (21st). The room was very spacious and clean. Great view. Desk was large enough to work on (for business travellers), and the in-room Internet connection was good. Free wireless is available in the lobby too. The bathroom was also a good size with full bath and separate shower, and the towels were probably the softest I've ever used at a hotel. I encountered one major problem - the phone. The phone had a problem with calling a double-line. That is, if I called someone using a number, the phone would call the number a second time on the second line which caused much confusion when I tried using room service and front desk. It took two hours for someone to come up look at it to tell me that it would take 24hr for a 3rd party to come in to fix it. I suppose I was just unlucky with this event. Like most hotels, room-service food was horrible. On the other hand, the hotel restaurant, Cafe Adelaide was fantastic. Probably one of the best meals in New Orleans. The service is spectacular. The restaurant belongs to the Commander's Palace Group. Location was central. Harrah's is located across the street, and the Canal Shopping Centre and Riverwalk Centre were both 2 blocks away. The Morial Convention Center was about 6 blocks away, but if your conference is on the far side... it's like walking an extra 6-8 blocks. The French Quarter is technically 2 blocks away, and the start of Bourbon Street was around 6 blocks away. Overall, it's central, but neither particularly close to the convention center or French Quarter. As a business traveller, this was OK, but a tourist may want a hotel closer to the French Quarter. This hotel location was near the end point of the several of the pre-Mardi Gras parades, which was a nice surprise. Overall, the hotel is good. Just felt the front desk service was a little off sometimes, the isolated phone problem and the location is only ideal for a business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!!! Great location”
Reviews.Author: Robyn808
Reviews.Content: We stayed in to hotels in New Orleans because of price and location. The Loews was our 2nd Hotel. We moved because we wanted to be closer to other attractions like Harrah's Casino, the Aqurium and Jackson Square. We were told that this hotel was far from the action of the French Quarter. So NOT true!!! I loved staying at this hotel. This side was so much cleaner and safer feeling. Mother's was right across the street... super yummy bread pudding!!! It was walking distance to the riverwalk shops. Gordon Biersh was next door to us in the Harrah's Hotel. The room was FANTASTIC!!! 2 queen beds... you can't go wrong with that because most rooms in New Orleans have 1 King or 1 Queen and then possibly 2 doubles. This hotel was only $149.00 compared to the other one which was $279 but we did stay there for New Year's Eve and Day plus the sugar bowl. I wish we could have stayed here the entire time!!!! It was safe to walk to Emeril's restaurant, which was good but pricey. I can't tell you enough.... I loved this hotel.... the location... and the price.... the view OMG! the view was fabulous too!!!! I posted some of my pictures. Check it out!!!

Reviews.Title: “it was really nice....but”
Reviews.Author: silliness
Reviews.Content: overall good BUT..... problems that should not happen.... 1. shower was scalding hot. when turned down....a trickle of water 2. a non-smoking room requested.....yet an ashtray and a room smelling of smoke. 3. valet parking receipt that says tax is included.....$3.48 charged as valet parking tax on the room bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: coconutkt
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. I stayed here for a conference, and though my flight arrived at 9 AM, they let me check in that morning with no hassle. The concierge was genuinely helpful and friendly, which was a welcomed change. The room I stayed in was WONDERFUL. It was bigger than my studio apartment and had two tvs, a couch, a king-sized bed, and a great view. The staff were always friendly. As to the location--the best. You are so close to the French Quarter (and its a safe walk), you are pretty much next to the Algiers Ferry, Harrah's Casino is across the street, and Mardi Gras parades listed in "uptown" concluded their route right near the hotel (some nights in front of the hotel, literally). The only disappointment I had with the hotel were the beds-nice linens, huge, but not very comfortable. Also, the walls were so thin I would frequently be woken up by people closing doors, etc. The only other thing I didn't like is that I ordered room service (and a VERY simple meal, at that), and it wasn't very tasty and was over-priced...even for room service. But, I would go back in a heartbeat. Their conference and meeting facilities are amazing, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic After the Pits!”
Reviews.Author: stoupagr
Reviews.Content: We walked over to the Loews from the awful hotel (Ambassador) we'd booked as it was where the wedding we were attending was being held. Wow! From hell to heaven!! They had a room, even though it was Sugar Bowl and New Year's time. The desk staff was efficient and pleasant. The room looked over the city and on to the Missippi. Wonderful bed, great towels, all the goodies in the bathroom. We were happy campers!!

Reviews.Title: “Great pick - walking distance from French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: ggtirevite
Reviews.Content: This brand new hotel was located 5 to 10 minutes walking distance from the French Quarter, and from the St-Charles streetcar line, which goes to the Garden DIstrict (a must do, and a great value $1.25 each way). Also located next door to the Harrah's Hotel and Casino. The rooms are big, so are the bathrooms. Separate large shower and tub. Nice window/lighting in the bathroom. A personal safe was in our room, as were comfy bathrobes. Internet (wired) access was free (at least with our room). Service at the hotel was very attentive, concierge was very personable and recommended several restaurants within walking distance. Only complaint is they did not make up our room on one occasion, before we got back around 5 PM. A quick call took care of that, and the room was clean by the time we got back after dinner. At $189 per nite, not the best bargain in town, but great location and brand new, so a good value.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with a fantastic bar and restaurant”
Reviews.Author: cyncity212
Reviews.Content: the lobby, staff and rooms are all very nice, but the reason I'll come back here is the Swizzle Stick bar!!! A classy place for exceptional cocktails, and resident mixologist Michael and his sidekick Mike were super friendly. Their specialty cocktails are amazing, and you might consider staying for dinner at the bar; the lobster bisque and shrimp corndogs were brilliant! I went back to the restaurant, cafe Adelaide, for a very special lunch, and the service and presentation were as top-notch as the food.

Reviews.Title: “I still think about this place!”
Reviews.Author: mllesarahk
Reviews.Content: It has been almost 3 years since my stay but I still think about this hotel and whenever I travel to a new city I check to see if there is a Loews to stay at because of it. I can't report on what it's like now, but I really loved this hotel. It was elegant and I loved the design. It felt posh but not so much so that it was uncomfortable. The light colors in the room were very relaxing, the down comforters and pillows, great sheets and marble bathroom also memorable. We got a steal on this place through expedia - around $100-$125 a night and it was definatley worth it. It's in a nice area within walking distance of the French Quarter area. Room service was a little pricey but that's the story for all hotels. The bar area was classy as well -had a nice martini. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: irwins0001
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby, good bar, large room by NO standards, good service

Reviews.Title: “Love the Loews”
Reviews.Author: ntravinsky
Reviews.Content: I love the LOEWS hotels. The lobbies, the rooms, and the staff are always extremely accomodating and helfpul. When I travel this is the first chain that I search for. I was sorry to see that they closed their Chicago location. With regards to the New Orleans location, it is directly across the street from the Harrahs casino (making it easy to come home after gambling!). It is also within a 3 minute walking distance to a new shopping center with a Saks Fifth Avenue and a movie theater. My husband and I managed to watch an independent film during our stay at the movie theater and were very happy to do so. The hotel had lemonade available upon checkin and the staff kindly assisted us to our rooms. We were given a nice corner room with so much space and a very nicely equipped bathroom. The beds at the Loews hotels are wonderful. There were 2 tvs in our room, one in front of the bed, and one in a sitting area. My husband and I ate at Adelaide's restaurant (in the hotel) and loved the food. EXCELLENT food and truly amazing service. All of our courses were served at the same time, literally. There were 3 of us at dinner and when the plates were set on the table, there were 3 people setting them down so they arrived at the exact same time. We were all really happy with the butternut squash soup, I ordered the beef and my husband ordered the lamb. Each dish was fantastic. As usual and as expected, the entire Loews experience was TOP NOTCH.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place--needs more help”
Reviews.Author: katediva
Reviews.Content: I was in New Orleans on business for 5 days and stayed at Loews. I had a king corner room--very large with excellent amenities. They do still seem to have an employee shortage--no doorman on duty some of the mornings to get me a cab and 2 of the 5 days I didn't think the room was cleaned very well. One odd thing is that they always seemed to want to turn down the bed (a nice touch few hotels still do)--but at 6pm which usually wasn't convenient.. Housekeeping staff also seemed to have extremely limited English which caused a few minor problems. Room service was good and quick--very important!--but the dinner menu needs more variety--especially since there's a great restaurant in the hotel. Lunch time martinis for 25 cents was a nice touch. Hotel staff were all very courteous and had a good attittude even when overwhelmed some mornings. I would rate the hotel above average to excellent and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ixmnrs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Loews for the weekend to attend a wedding in New Orleans and we were pleasantly surprised at how nice the hotel was. It was very conveniently located with most French Quarter, Riverwalk, Harrah's Casino and Canal Place Shops all within comfortable walking distance. The hotel was very clean and the staff was very nice. We stayed on the 19th floor King Corner Suite which faced the Harrah's hotel, but had river views to either side of it. The bathroom was very luxurious, much better than the marriotts and sheratons where we usually stay. Nightly turndown service and high speed internet access was a plus. All in all we were very impressed with the property and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Friendly”
Reviews.Author: bwoz
Reviews.Content: The Loews New Orleans Hotel was absolutely gorgeous and had incredible staff...very, very friendly and helpful. The room was clean, the bathroom gorgeous and the linens fantastic. View from the 16th floor to the river - amazing and this hotel is one block from the French Quarter. (Note: wear comfy shoes and be prepared to walk in this city!) ESPECIALLY nice: The front desk manager heard me mention that this was a weekend trip prior to my husband deploying for Iraq and sent us complimentary wine/strawberries the last night of our stay - I was really touched and hope the GM got the note of praise I left for this employee! Downside: hidden parking charges per night. Didn't expect those. And be prepared to tip...keep the ones and fives on you! All in all, if you can afford the place, stay there. (PS - there are some great deals going on this summer!)

Reviews.Title: “Loews New Orleans found my cell phone-great service!”
Reviews.Author: MarieTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Loews and was not disappointed. I didn't realize that my daughter had left her cell phone in the room until we arrived home nine hours later. Upon arriving home, we found that someone from the Loews security staff had already contacted us. The phone was shipped to me within 48 hours! What service! The hotel was beautiful, great location and great staff. Everyone was very accommodating and professional. After calling the front desk to explain that I didn't understand how to adjust the thermostat in my room, a maintenance man showed up within minutes! The valet parking had in-out privileges and my car was always brought up to the front timely. While having a night cap in the bar, we were given complimentary desserts. Although the treats were left over from the days business in the restaurant, they still fresh and very yummy! What a nice gesture. This is my second experience with Loews and I can't say enough about how pleased I was with everything. My other stay was at the Loews Miami on South Beach several years ago....what a gem! Same great service and what a location....right on the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway”
Reviews.Author: bigbio37
Reviews.Content: Let me tell you,after losing my father a week earlier i needed a place that would really take my mind off things.The exprience there was outstanding.From the desk clerk,to the bell boy ,everyone made you fill at home.The rooms we're huge not to mention my wife and i were on the 14th floor to get a unbeliveveable view of the city.Very nice.....indeed.

Reviews.Title: “WOW. Loved the Loews!”
Reviews.Author: SPellegrino
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights for a conference in July. Truly everything about this hotel was first-class -- it was one of my best hotel stays in 20+ years of travel. The Loews New Orleans is very stylish and to a person everyone there was friendly and helpful. The check-in was smooth (even with my discounted Travelocity room rate of $104), and with my high floor request I received the top floor of the hotel. In four days I rode express to the 21st floor on the elevators with no stops or waiting most of the trips. My room was large, clean, comfortable, quiet, and very well air-conditioned. There was a great view of the river, bridge, and city. The bed was superb. In my closet I found an umbrella to use during my stay. It was much bigger than the one I brought so I ended up using it most days. The elegant bathroom had granite (?) countertops and enough towels for four people. Every day my room was cleaned beautifully. The housekeeping staff were polite when knocking, and understanding when asked to come back. One day they even left a small fabric mat under my toothbrush. In a rush, I'd forgotten my toothpaste and sheepishly asked for help at the desk -- and promptly received a small tube, no charge. The concierge(s) helped me find a shoe repair shop and checked diligently for an open seat on the airport shuttle bus. Finally, the doormen at the Loews New Orleans were simply the best -- even while working in the extreme heat or rain. I watched one doorman get soaked in rainstorm as he held his umbrella over a guest as she made her way from the cab to the door. Another doorman helped me understand the best/driest walking routes to the convention center. The only small mistake made during my entire stay was fixed promptly and with an apology (an incorrect room charge). The location works well for a conference in the convention center (about 3-4 blocks) yet it is still close to the French Quarter (about 6-8 blocks). The pool and gym looked great but I didn't use them. Also did not use parking or the restaurant. The entire staff at the Loews is very service-oriented, friendly, and polite. They made it clear that New Orleans is indeed open for business. I will stay at this Loews again, for sure, on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Bon temps in Loews”
Reviews.Author: Westby
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Loews Hotel New Orleans for a conference in July 2007. It was not one of the conference hotels, but from what I hear from fellow conference attendees, I think it was the best deal in town. The rooms were a good size (the bed and pillows were so comfortable!), the bathrooms were modern and well-appointed, 2 bathrobes were provided, nice fitness area and lap pool (2 lanes), plus a wonderful lounge space on the main lobby floor. The staff was attentive and helpful. The hotel is 2 blocks from Harrah's Casino and a short walk to the French Quarter. The Hilton is 2 blocks away (many of our conference events were held there) and the convention center is about 5-6 blocks away. Mother's, a popular breakfast establishment, is 1 block away. Emeril's restaurant (where we had a completely fabulous meal) is about 3-4 blocks away on Tchoupitoulas. The lovely modern lounge area provides a relaxing space. Wifi is free throughout the ground floor lobby area, but $12.95 in the rooms (seems excessive). Staff were exceedingly pleasant and helpful. I loved the bath products provided. For those traveling with pets, the hotel is pet-friendly. I shared an elevator with 2 chihuahuas. I paid the gov't rate of $102/night + taxes, which came to about $118/night. At the time, they were offering a "buy 3 nights, get the 4th free" rate that was comparable. Friends booked into suites on the 18th floor that were not much more expensive and offered additional space. I wish I had discovered the lever that adjusted the water pressure earlier on - I took a few very low-pressure showers before I noticed it adjusted. The housekeeping staff removed the bar soap each day and replaced with fresh soap, which seemed a bit unnecessary to me and a giant waste of soap. In the bar, the Bloody Marys weren't very good (too much spice and too many extraneous vegetables - string beans?!?), but the waiter apologized and offered to remove the drinks from the receipt. He was very attentive to our needs and conveyed how much the staff love working at the Loews. It definitely shows. I will look for a Loews again in my future travels. PS As a side note, for those who may be hesitant of visiting New Orleans post-Katrina, the convention center area and the French Quarter area were not as affected and don't really appear any different to the average tourist. Further out, there is still significant damage. We took a brief tour of the Lower 9th Ward that was sobering. That said, the local people are SO HAPPY to have visitors in their city and thrilled to welcome you. Everyone - the cab drivers, the shop owners, the bartenders, etc. - will tell you how happy they are to see you and thank you profusely for keeping their city alive. It's definitely worth a visit. If you do, check out the wonderful NOLA Habitat for Humanity. They are doing fantastic work, particularly at Musicians' Village [--]

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Not Far from the Main Area”
Reviews.Author: Abbey K
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Loews while I was in town at a conference and I was really happy that I did. I was originally going to stay at the Hilton next door where the conference was held, but it seemed really old and outdated so I chose the Loews. My coworker was completely jealous when she came over to the lobby of the Loews to meet me one night! I stayed in a luxury suite for only $125 a night and it was well worth it, huge bed, very clean and the staff very helpful. I also ate breakfast two mornings at the Adelaide, Swizzle Stick Bar and Cafe downstairs in the lobby and it was fantastic! I wish I had discovered the Cafe earlier in the week because I surely would have gone each morning for breakfast. I also used the gym which was nice and a small indoor pool. It is right next door to the Casino and the W hotel which has a nice bar in it. It is a short walk from Canal Street and the upscale store areas, and then you're in the French Quarter. For places to eat, try Mother's across the street from the hotel, if you're adventurous and feel like biscuits, ham and grits - true N'Awlins cooking. I also had very good lunches, not expensive at the cute little La Boucherie Coffee House on Chartres street , and the Red Fish Grille closer to Bourbon. New Orleans is very much a walkable city so nothing seemed too far a part. I would definitely stay at the Loews again without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Views”
Reviews.Author: Needadayoff
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the very large Realtor Tradeshow conference in November 2006. What a great hotel. My room had a beautiful view. The beds were comfortable, the staff was always courteous and very helpful. The food in the resturaunt was good. It was fairly close to everything and the concierge did a great job booking us nice restuaurants in the area. I would definitely stay here again for work or for personal travel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Schmidtie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May for a convention. I love the intimate, well appointed lobby as it's easy to find colleagues at a glance. Breakfast buffet very reasonable and delicious although a great joint down the street called Mother's serves New Orleans style meals too Concierge very polite and helpful as I was always in need of directions. large, clean fitness center and pool room was very large and seemed brand new - had a nice view of the river A bit of a walk to Bourbon Street but not too bad - took a (cheap) cab a few times and hotel is next door to Harrah's I was worried about being in New Orleans and left all of my jewelry at home. I felt very safe and never threatened although friends who went for long jogs got an eerie feeling of emptiness once out of the French quarter Definitely get out of the French quarter so you can see the remains of the devastation of Katrina. So many homes are vacant and not repaired. I took a cab tour of the 9th ward and recommend this. The Lowe's door man ordered a special cab for this. There were three of us and it was about $170 for a quick one hour tour and return trip to the airport. I thought this was very expensive but then again felt okay making the contribution to the local economy. Our guide was very thorough and a local. Bourbon Street was alive - but then again there were 20,000 conventioneers there. Not sure what it's like on an off-night but would recommend going if it's in your plans.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Loews”
Reviews.Author: RobertAJefferson
Reviews.Content: The Loews New Orleans is a wonderful hotel. The room was spotless when we arrived, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The decor of the room was first class, and the bed was VERY comfortable. The location is ideal for french quarter fun, and the area feels very safe at night. We did not care for the $30.00 a day valet parking fee, but parking is always expensive in New Orleans anyway. We found a $12.00 a day parking lot next door to the hotel, and used it for the last two days of our stay. The hotel is VERY pet friendly, which is a big plus in our book!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gchu
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice and clean hotel. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was ok. The room was not very large. But we did have plenty of room. It is a little far from the french quarter. There are no vending machines in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: like2travelWa
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd trip to N.O. I booked a B&B and a hotel for work due to limited availability during the week of Mar 25th. My travel agent booked Loews hotel in the Business District at $244/nt. This is a very nice hotel and they do have a doorman. You must valet park and it is ~$30/day. The French Quarters is 4 blocks away and the Harrahs casino is nearby. My room was nice - modern decoration and spacious with 2 TVs, one for the 'lounge' area and one directly in front of the bed. The concierge recommended a southern type restaurant across the street. It is overrated and pricey - I think it has become a 'tourist trap' type restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: LynetteRZ
Reviews.Content: One of the finest hotels in New Orleans! Great service - excellent location, perfect service! I have visited the city numerous times both pre and post Katrina and this hotel has it all. My husband and I were not disappointed, in fact we are returning for another stay at the end of the month. I will be surprised if we ever stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: rsted222
Reviews.Content: What an impressive place. If you want very clean, comfy rooms in a great location.....stay here. I was very, very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: ariana
Reviews.Content: I was in New Orleans on business, and greatly appreciated the quiet, comfortable room. Excellent bed, good desk, a nice roomy space. Great bathroom lighting. The staff was exceptional, especially in Adelaides bar and restaurant. Friendly and efficient. Location is good, close to Harrah's casino and the French Quarter, which are up and running. Gym and pool are truly exceptional (except for the lack of an elliptical trainer). But a lovely small lap pool and sauna, exercise balls, free weights and good exercise space made up for it. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “not the same hotel as before......”
Reviews.Author: plaborde
Reviews.Content: I recently took my family to a quick weekend trip in New Orleans. We have stayed at the Loews in times past and the hotel has always exceeded our expectations. This stay differed completely from our past stays. The rooms are not as clean as you would expect from a hotel of this quality. The noise from the club next door was so bad we had to change rooms. The overall condition of the second room was the same as the first. The staff was friendly but not professional. My conclusion is that good staff is hard to come by in post Katrina New Orleans. I would recommend the Winsor Court to any visitor in the future who expects a first rate stay. I rate the Loews a little above the Holiday Inn. Our first stay at the hotel several years ago was one of my best overall experiences of any hotel in New Orleans. The staff was very professional and attended to our every need. They even had gift bags for my young children. The gift bags made the hotel my childrenâ€™s favorite and they insisted we stay at the "hotel that has the cool ducks toys in the blue bag". After my last experience, I doubt I will stay at the Loews again.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: Buckawatts
Reviews.Content: Loews New Orleans has great value for their prices. The rooms are large and spacious and the staff is ultra friendly.. My wife stayed the night before our wedding in December of 2006 and we stayed the night of the wedding. The rooms are large enough for several people to get dressed in at once. The bathrooms are also very big. The Loews is right across the street from Harrah's New Orleans Casino and just blocks from the French Quarter and Burbon Street. Be prepared to pay for parking- it is around $30 a night. (Most hotels in this area require you to pay for valet parking). Other than that, excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, location and FOOD!”
Reviews.Author: tiffnco
Reviews.Content: I was recently in New Orleans for a convention and I selected the Loews as my "home away from home." Upon arrival to the hotel, I was greeted warmly by the doorman (there was ALWAYS a doorman there too...no other hotel I visited had that!) and was escorted to the front desk. The agent checking me in was also warm and seemed very happy to be of service. The room was large, bright and comfortable. I had high ceilings which added to the spacious feel of the room. The bed was great, the room was clean and contemporary...and very comfortable. The one thing that struck me over my stay at the Loews was how friendly EVERY staff member was. From the room service staff to the front desk and even the bar. Oh, and speaking of the bar...they had a nightly drink special which was $2. Show me another hotel that sells you anything for $2...let alone something with alcohol in it! I've stayed at many places around the country and can honestly say that this stay ranks as one of my best hotel experiences. The service was superior to that at some of the Four Seasons and the like. If you are looking for a hotel in New Orleans...you can't go wrong with the Loews. The location is great...walking distance to the French Quarter and close to Riverwalk and the Convention Center. Thank you Loews for a great stay! I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “LUXURY hotel for Pet Owners”
Reviews.Author: traveling*chococat
Reviews.Content: It was our very first trip to New Orleans but we had our dog & cat with us. What a joy to encounter the Loews New Orleans and their wonderful southern hospitality. We booked the hotel the night before our arrival on December 17, 2006 and were told that "pets are very welcome with us." Everyone, from the front bellmen, valet parkers, front desk and housekeeping were friendly and helpful- and NICE to our pets. Our dog even had the hotel's front door opened to him by the bellman as he entered and exited the hotel. Only drawback is limited walking areas for more active dogs (as ours is). But, we loved Loews so much that we could overlook that. Also, when we entered our spacious, clean and BEAUTIFUL room, we were pleased to see dog bowls, a dog place mat, dog treats and a letter from the hotel manager's pet pooch for us. What a nice touch! Also, if you join their "frequent hotel stayer plan" (which is easy and free), valet parking is complimentary and you are given a gift on arrival, such as wine or a fruit basket. The Loews chain has made a fan for life, we even changed our "across the country" drive itinerary so that we could stop in Tucson to stay at the Loews there. Have to say the NO Loews is a touch better than the Tucson Loews. But, we were so happy with the NO Loews we are still singing their praises to all of our friends who have pets as well as those who do not.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rie'smom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend stay at the Loews hotel in New Orleans. It is a wonderful hotel. From the time we drove up until we left,we experienced top notch service. The staff is so courteous-more so than many hotels we've frequented. Because we're Loews gold members,we were upgraded to a Grand Deluxe room. Our views of the Mississippi River were outstanding. The room was very spacious. The bathroom was nicest we've ever seen in a hotel. We were tired(our daughter was in an all day cheer competition) so we decided to order room service. The hotel restaurant,Cafe Adelaide,is owned by the Brennan family-Commander's Palace,Mr. Bs,etc. The food was everything one would expect from a Brennan's owned restaurant-superb! Our server was very sweet. We walked to the French Quarter-about 1/2 mile away. It was a delightful walk. If going to "the Big Easy", I heartily recommend this hotel. You won't regret this choice.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Loew's New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: dhcmemphis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Loew's for the weekend and loved it. The room was beautiful, large and quiet, with a great view of the Mississippi River. You could walk to the Superdome, French Quarter, RiverWalk and it was across the street from Harrah's Casino. The lobby bar was lovely with a very talented couple quietly entertaining by playing and singing old standards. We did not eat at the restaurant, Adelaide, but our friends said the food was delicious. The staff makes the hotel. They are friendly and welcoming. We're hoping to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Loews First is a must”
Reviews.Author: jsantora
Reviews.Content: I discovered The Loews chain last December when we stayed in the Miami Beach location. A month later we had a stay at the San Diego location. Both were great expericees but did not compare to the level of service at the New Orleans location. Keep in mind I signed up for the Loews First program before our Miami stay so I am now at the Gold Level and let me tell you it is worth it. The staff here is very courteous the hotel is extrememly clean and the location is wonderful. The spa is the only thing that I was disappointed in but it is by no means a bad spa. Try this place you will like it. Loews first is a must with each stay my service gets better and better. joe Cleveland, Ohio

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic bar/lounge - check it out!!!”
Reviews.Author: m a
Reviews.Content: we discovered Adelaide's at the Loew's Hotel through a fantastic LA blog (www.gumbopages.com.) We wandered in around 5PM the Saturday before Mardi Gras - Endemyon parade had been cancelled, it was raining like hell, winds blowing. The bar was the perfect place to sit out the storm. Friendly people all around including many in costumes from earlier parades. Service understandibly a bit slow but pleasant and warm. After waiting a few minutes, we were able to grab a table near a window where we sat for hours, eating delicious bar food, drinking dirty martinis and watching the wind and rain and our fellow bar patrons have a very good time. Bar food was delicious, we had several rounds of great snacks and drinks. No rush, no attitude, friendly people all around. Great place to hang out, we'll be back for drinks and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Loews New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: BrookeD
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three-night stay at the Loews New Orleans hotel. We had a grand luxury king room and it was wonderful -- new, clean, spacious, and a wonderful, cozy bed made up with crisp white linens and a down duvet. The bathroom was large with a tub and separate walk-in shower. Our room was turned down every night, with bathrobes laid out and chocolates placed on the nightstand. The lobby of the hotel is also beautiful. There's a wonderful tile mosaic of New Orleans behind the front desk and the furnishings are beautiful throughout. We didn't eat at Cafe Adelaide, but the menu looked great. New Orleans is still a wonderful place to visit and they need our support. Please don't hesitate to come here and experience the unique culture that is New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Lowes is Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: With a little trepedation about returning to N.O. in mid January, my friend and I drove from Houston to the Lowes. Valet service was nice and patient; front desk couldn't find my reservation and I was forced to prove that I had one. I went to the 8th floor business center to print out the reservation from the Hotwire website and went back down to present it to the front desk clerk. He punched in the number and then exclaimed, "Oh! The computer had your last name as your first, and your first as your last. That's why we couldn't find it." Well duh... I thought that's a basic duty of a front desk clerk to check on such things! Anyways it was an anoyance and a little bit discomforting. But maybe I should have told him to check! Overall the property is quite nice. Lobby and dining area,cocktail lounge are done in nice mature beiges with furnishings to match. Not too garish and not to frilly, but just right. Mature and sophisticated. Rooms are huge as are the bathrooms. All marble tubs and separate glass-enclosed shower with thick towels and nice bath robes. Beds are a joy. Fresh linen, and comforters to match. Staff were quite professional and nice. Absolutely no bad attitudes. We stayed on the 18th floor. The workout facilities and the lap pool and jacuzzi on the 8th floor are worth it. I had room service, and note to others: you must complete the door menu for breakfast on the weekends BEFORE 10AM or else you'll be forced to order from the lunch menu. A little bit of an unpleasant surprise if you enjoy lounging late in bed on a beautiful Sunday. My guess it's because of the lack of available workers due to Katrina. Overall I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in Crescent City.”
Reviews.Author: juanlb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel from August 7th through the 11th of 2005. The hotel is well located, specially if attending a convention (Morial center is about 5 blocks away, easily walked) but equally convenient to the french quarter and streetcar lines to the garden district. The hotel is pretty drab from the exterior, but doesn't disappoint once you step inside. It has a very nice lobby with beautiful stained glass panels, and the adjacent Swizzle Stick bar is comfortable, cozy and hip. Our room had a nice view, the decoration was ok, but nothing extraordinary. The room was generally well-equipped with 2 phone lines and 2 phones (one cordless), coffee maker, hair dryer, high speed DSL (at no addtional cost) and a big desk and reading chair. The mattress, pillows and linens were great, along with the toiletries. The hotel has a small but relaxing indoor pool and a well-equipped gym. The concierge was very helpful in providing tourist info, maps and the sort. Overall service was above average. Considering the rate I paid (around $130 per night with taxes included) I don't think we could've done better. The only thing that wasn't satisfactory was the cost of valet service which at $28 per day seems excessive. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good lodging accomodations, subpar service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel's accomodations were very good. The beds were very comfortable and the room was nicely decorated. However, for the level of hotel that it is, the service left much to be desired. The bartender was rude and neither the manager nor the concierge responded with anything above an apology. We had reservations three weeks in advance but our room category was unavailable at check-in. They upgraded us, but failed to communicate this with us and we had to call down to find out that we had been upgraded. We did not receive our Loews First welcome amenity. While my accommodations were nice, I feel what sets hotels of this class apart is service. So if service is what you crave, try the Ritz or the Sheraton instead.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Loews of New Orleans certainly misrepresented itself to me. I booked two rooms at the top rate. I made sure to join the Loews First club in advance of this costly stay. I anticipated earning points towards another stay within their chain,or with one of their business partners. However, here I am several months later, ready to collect and I am told- no deal! They did not credit either of our rooms and all the expensive food we ate, due to the fact that we booked our stay through the convention tourist agency! What a rip off!! None of this information was offered to me when I set up the membership! No other chain has such a policy! As for the hotel-the location is good but the hotel it is average in every way. There is no shortage of hotels to choose from in The Big Easy. As always - New Orleans as a city does not disappoint!

HotelInfo.Name: Loews New Orleans Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 300 Poydras St, New Orleans, LA 70130
